Alicia es una mujer de 56 años, vive en la ciudad de Pisco con sus 3 hijos, a quienes ama y son su principal razón en la vida, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora  y entusiasta, que lamentablemente sufrió la pérdida de su amado esposo, desde entonces ella ha dedicado todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tuvo desde muy joven de trabajar, Alicia no pudo estudiar una carrera profesional, pero le hubiera gustado mucho poder hacerlo, en sus ratos libres le gusta cocinar y en algunas ocasiones prepara un riquísimo Seco de Res para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Alicia trabaja en las mañana como chofer de mototaxi, brindando servicios de transporte en su ciudad y adicionalmente en las tardes vende refrescos y raspadillas de diversos sabores, ella trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por el trato amable que brinda a sus clientes.
Alicia se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar el mejoramiento de dos habitaciones de su vivienda, ya que actualmente estas son de esteras y plásticos, de esta manera ella podrá construir sus habitaciones con materiales adecuados, que brinden mayor seguridad y bienestar para su familia, asi pues Alicia seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de terminar la construcción de su vivienda.
texts.en: Alicia, 56, lives in the city of Pisco with her three children, whom she loves and are her main reason for living. She is a very friendly, hard-working, and enthusiastic person, who sadly lost her beloved husband. Since then, she has put all her efforts into moving her family forward. Unfortunately, due to a lack of economic resources and because she has had to work since she was very young, Alicia was not able to study a professional degree, but she would have liked to do so. In her free time, she likes to cook and sometime she prepares a delicious Seco de Res to share with her family. On her own initiative, and with a lot of dedication and effort, Alicia works in the morning as a mototaxi driver, providing transportation services in her city. In the afternoons she sells soft drinks and snow cones in many flavors. She works every day for about ten hours and believes that it's going well for her because of the friendly way she treats her customers. Alicia is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, because thanks to them, she will be able to make improvements to two rooms in her home, which are currently made of rush mats and plastic. This way, she will be able to build these rooms out of adequate materials, which will bring her family better wellbeing and security. Alicia will continue to work and make an effort to achieve her big dream of finishing construction on her house.

loans.use: to make improvements to two rooms.

loans.name: Diriangen Group

texts.es: Grupo formado por tres socias emprendedoras de éxitos una de ellas es Rosa tiene 46 años de edad, casada y con cuatro  hijos. Tiene 10 años de tener un restaurante en un centro turístico de su comunidad, su esposo le ayuda en la administración del negocio, el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de granos básicos como arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceite, cervezas, carne de res, carne de pollo, perecederos, verduras, gaseosas de todos los sabores etc. Maria tiene 46 años de edad hace y vende nacatamales en su domicilio y Alba tiene 47 años de eda
texts.en:
This group is made up of three successful entrepreneurial members. Rosa is 46 years old, married, and has four children. For the last 10 years, she has had a restaurant at a tourism center in her community. Her husband helps to manage the business. The loan will be used to buy basic items such as rice, beans, sugar, oil, beer, beef, chicken, perishables, vegetables, different flavors of soda, etc. 

Maria is 46 years old; she makes and sells nacatamales [Nicaraguan tamales] out of her house. Alba is 47 years old.

loans.use: to buy basic items such as rice, beans, sugar, oil, beer, beef, chicken, perishables, vegetables, different flavors of soda, etc.

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es: Este grupo está formado por tres socios de éxito una de ellas es Maricela quien tiene 32 años de edad, casada, con dos hijos menores, desde hace 4 años es propietaria de su negocio que es la venta de muebles de diferentes clases de material y variados tales como juegos de mimbres, juegos de trébol, juegos de muebles de conchita y artesanías de cerámicas como jarrones de barros grandes, en el negocio le ayudan cuatro familiares de los cuales solamente a dos les paga salarios el resto ella los mantiene económicamente. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de muebles tales como juegos de mimbres, juegos de muebles estilo trébol, juego de muebles de conchita, jarrones de barros grande etc. Geydi tiene 25 años vende fritanga en su domicilio y Orlando vende productos lácteos como crema acida, queso, leche etc.
texts.en:
This group is formed by three successful partners; one of them is Maricela who is 32 years old, married with two small children. She has been a business owner for 4 years selling furniture of different types of materials and assortments such as wicker furniture set, cloverleaf and shell style furniture sets, and ceramic crafts such as big clay vases. Four relatives help her with her business, two of whom she pays and the rest she supports financially. 

The loan will be invested for the purchase of furniture such as wicker sets, cloverleaf and shell style furniture sets, big clay vases etc... 

Geydi is 25 years old she sells fried food from her home and Orlando sells dairy products such as sour cream, cheese, milk etc...

loans.use: to purchase furniture such as wicker sets, cloverleaf and shell style furniture sets, big clay vases etc...

loans.name: Gloria Santa

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Calle América se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar vive la señora Gloria, tiene 44 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen un hijo el cual ya es mayor  de edad e independiente. Su esposo es albañil.

Doña Gloria tiene una tienda de víveres en su casa en la cual vende productos de primera necesidad como: arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes entre otras cosas, además de ciertas bebidas como sodas y aguas. Ella en las tardes también vende hamburguesas, hot dogs y sodas en una carreta que tiene. Trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 21h00 y a veces hasta más tarde, su esposo le ayuda en su trabajo cuando está desocupado. Tiene su tienda más de 12  años y  gracias a los  créditos la ido mejorando con el pasar de los días.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, detergentes, salchichas, carne y otros víveres para hacer los hot dogs y hamburguesas y para surtir su tienda. Está en el Banco Comunal desde el inicio y le gusta porque con los  créditos cada día mejora más su negocio. 

Sus metas son seguir adelante en su negocio de comida y que su tienda crezca cada día más.
texts.en:
The America Street Communal Bank meets every 15 days in the town of Cantón Montecristi. The town is known for its rich pre colonial culture and for its arts and crafts that are recognized at the national and international levels. It is a place especially known for its famous woven straw hats. 

Gloria lives in this town. She is 44 years old and is married. From her marriage she has one son who is an adult and is independent. Her husband is a stonemason. 

Gloria has a grocery store in her home where she sells basic necessity products such as: rice, sugar, oils and detergents, among other things. She also sells certain drinks like soda and water. During the afternoon she also sells hamburgers, hotdogs and sodas from a cart she has. She works every day from 6:00 am to 9:00 pm, and sometimes later. Her husband helps her with her work when he is unoccupied. She has had her store for more than 12 years and, thanks to the loans she receives, it is improving with the passing of each day. 

She will use this loan to buy rice, sugar, oil, detergents, sausages, meat and other groceries to make hotdogs, hamburgers and to stock her store. She has participated in the Communal Bank since it began. She likes it because the loans improve her business more each day.

Her goals are to get ahead with her food selling business and to continue growing her store every day.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oil, detergents, sausages, meat and other groceries.

loans.name: Rosa Hilda

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Calle América se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

La señora Rosa tiene 85 años de edad, hace varios años su esposo falleció, pero de esa relación tiene 8 hijos los cuales ya son mayores de edad e independientes, con ella vive un nieto de 15 años el cual es su compañía.
 
Doña Rosa para ganar el sustento diario se dedica a la venta de pescado, este es un negocio que tenían junto a su esposo y que cuando el falleció ella tuvo que seguir en el negocio el cual le ha permitido salir adelante. Dos veces por semana se traslada hasta la ciudad de Manta a comprar el mejor pescado para luego enviarlo a la ciudad de Quito lugar donde viven sus hijos los mismos que venden este producto en esta ciudad y  luego se encargan de enviar el dinero para continuar con el negocio, lleva más de 30 años con este negocio.

Este crédito es para comprar pescado. Es socia fundadora del Banco comunal y le gusta porque los créditos son rápidos y con ellos puede mantener su negocio. 
 
Sus sueños son  mejorar su salud  ya que actualmente está muy delicada y continuar en su negocio.
texts.en: The Calle América communal bank meets every two weeks in Montecristi Canton, known for its rich pre-colonial culture and its handicrafts, for which it is known nationally and internationally. It is where the famous straw hats are made. Rosa is 85 years old. Her husband died several years ago, but she has eight children as a result of this relationship who are now grown and independent. She has a 15-year-old granddaughter who lives with her for company. To earn a living, Rosa works selling fish. This is a business that she and her husband had together, and when he died, she had to continue with the business, which allowed her to move forward. She goes to Manta twice a week to buy the best fish. Then she sends it to Quito where her children live. They sell the product in the city, and then they send the money to continue with the business. She has been in this business for more than 30 years. This loan is to buy fish. She is a founding member of the communal bank and she likes it because the loans are fast and she can use them to support her business. Her dreams are to continue with her business and improve her health, because she is currently very delicate.

loans.use: to buy fish.

loans.name: Lucrecia Feliza

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Calle América que se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar vive la señora Lucrecia, tiene 53 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene 5 hijos, todos mayores de edad, tres de ellos aun están solteros y  vive en su casa. Su esposo trabaja de conserje en un colegio.

Doña Lucrecia tiene una panadería en su casa, allí junto a sus hijos todos los días preparan el delicioso pan que es indispensable en la mesa de los habitantes de su ciudad, ellos también prepara tortas, bizcochuelos y helados de varios sabores que son muy apetecidos por sus clientes, ella vende los helados en su local o también sale a vender en lugares donde se reúnen las personas ya que esto le deja muy buenos ingresos. Trabajan todos los días, desde las 5h00 que se levantan a hornear el pan para que cuando sus clientes lleguen todo esté listo, su esposo también les ayuda sobre todo los fines de semana cuando está desocupado, llevan en este negocio más de 12 años y les va muy bien ya que cuentan con muy buena clientela.

Este crédito lo van a utilizar en comprar harina, sal, azúcar y otros víveres necesarios para elaborar el pan y sus deliciosos helados. Lleva 8 ciclos en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan con los créditos. 

Su sueño es tener otro local en el centro de la ciudad.
texts.en:
The Calle America Communal Bank meets every 15 days in the Montecristi region, an area known for its rich pre-colonial culture and for its artisan crafts that are recognized at the national and international levels. This is the place with the famous straw sombreros.

In this place lives Lucrecia who is 53 years old, married, and has five children, all of whom are grown. Three of them are single and live in her house. Her husband works as a college counselor.

Lucrecia has a bread bakery in her home. There, along with her children, she prepares every day the delicious bread that is indispensable at the tables of the city's inhabitants. They also prepare cakes, shortcakes, and ice creams in a variety of flavors, which her customers love to eat. She sells the ice creams from her home, and she also goes out to sell them in places where people gather because this generates good revenues. They work every day from 5 am, when they get up to bake the bread so that when her customers arrive, everything will be ready. Her husband also helps her every weekend when he is not busy. They have had this business for more than 12 years and it is going very well for them since they have such a good clientele.

They will use this loan to purchase flower, salt, sugar, and other basic items that are needed to make the bread and the delicious ice creams. Lucrecia has been with the communal bank for eight cycles and she likes it because of the help that the loans give her.

Her dream is to have another shop in the center of the city.

loans.use: purchase flour, salt, sugar, and other basic items

loans.name: Shirley Dayana

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Calle América se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar vive la señora Shirley, tiene 19 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen un hijo de tres años. Su esposo es albañil.
 
Ella se dedica a su hogar al comercio ya que su esposo no gana mucho y en ocasiones se queda sin trabajo y con sus ganancias es como salen adelante. La señora Shirley vende ropa de todo tipo, zapatillas y productos de Esika(artículos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorio para damas). Su forma de venta es puerta a puerta,  trabaja todos los días ya que también vende en su casa, lleva más de 5 años con su negocio el cual le ha permitido salir adelante con su familia.

Este crédito es para comprar ropa, zapatillas y cosméticos Esika. Está en el Banco Comunal hace 4 ciclos y le gusta porque los créditos salen rápido y le ayudan mucho. 

Su sueño es crecer en su negocio.
texts.en:
The "Calle América" communal bank meets every fortnight in the Montecristi district.  Famous for it rich pre-colonial culture and for its nationally internationally recognised artisan products, straw hats also come from here.

Shirley, 19 years old, lives here in Montecristi.  She is married and has a three-year-old son with her husband, who works as a builder.

Shirley has a business at home as her husband does not earn a lot of money and sometimes finds himself without work.  With Shirley's income, the family can move forward.  Shirley's business is selling all types of clothes as well as trainers and Esika products (beauty items, make-up, perfumes and women's accessories).  She sells door-to-door and from home.  She has had the business for five years and it has allowed the family to prosper.

This loan will be used to buy clothes, trainers and Esika make-up.  After four cycles with the communal bank, Shirley likes it because the loans are quick and are a great help to her.

Shirley's dream to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy clothes, trainers and Esika make-up.

loans.name: Paula Monserrate

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Calle América que se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar vive la señora Paula, tiene 32 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de 12, 9 y 7  años de edad, todos estudia en escuela. Su esposo es comerciante.
 
Doña Paula realiza el crédito para el negocio del esposo, él se dedica  a la venta de pescado, todos los días se desplaza hasta la ciudad de Manta lugar donde compra buen pescado a muy buen precio y luego regresa a Montecristi a recorrer la ciudad en un triciclo ofreciendo sus productos, lleva más de 18 años en este negocio y fue algo que aprendió desde pequeño ya que antes el acompañaba a su mamá en este negocio hasta que se independizó y ahora es la fuente de ingresos con el cual saca adelante a su familia.

Este crédito es para comprar pescado. Lleva más de 13 años  en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los créditos le ayudan a financiar su negocio.
 
Su sueño es tener un carro para que su marido realice sus ventas con más comodidad.
texts.en:
The Calle America Communal Bank meets every 15 days in the Montecristi region, an area known for its rich pre-colonial culture and for its artisan crafts that are recognized at the national and international levels. This is the place with the famous straw sombreros.

In this place lives Paula. She is 32 years old, married, and from this relationship has three children who are 12, nine, and seven years old. All of the children go to school. Her husband is a businessman.

Paula is taking out this loan for her husband's business. He sells fish. Every day he goes to the city of Manta where he buys good fish at a great price and later returns to Montecristi to go around the city on a tricycle, offering his products. He has had this business more than 18 years, and it was something that he learned as a little boy. Before, he used to help his mother with this business until he became independent. Now this is the source of income that the family uses to get ahead.

This loan is to purchase fish. Paula has been in the communal bank more than 13 years, and she likes it because the loans help them finance their business.

Her dream is to have a car so her husband can make his sales more comfortably.

loans.use: buy fish

loans.name: Aura Cecilia

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Calle América que se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar vive la señora Aura, tiene 34 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos de 15, 13, 11 y 4  años de edad, los dos mayores  estudian en colegio y el menor  en escuela. Su esposo es comerciante.
 
Doña Aura para ganar algo y con esto poder ayudar con los gastos que genera el hogar se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta, ella sale dos o tres días por semana a recorrer por toda la ciudad ofreciendo sus productos, trabaja todos los días ya qua también vende en su  casa a donde llegan sus clientes más conocidos. Su mercadería  la va a comprar a  Guayaquil cada vez que necesita. Tiene 5 años que se dedica a esta actividad y le ha ido muy bien.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace 4 ciclos y le gusta porque con los créditos cada vez aumenta su negocio.
 
Su sueño es tener bien arreglada su casa con todas las comodidades.
texts.en:
The Calle America Communal Bank meets every 15 days in Montecristi Canton, known for its rich pre-colonial culture and its artisan crafts. It is recognized at the national and international level. This is where the famous toquilla straw hats are made.

Here resides Aura, who is 34 years old, married, and from this relationship has come 4 children, ages 15, 13, 11 and 4. The 2 elder children study in a secondary school and the younger children in a primary school. Aura's husband is also a merchant.
 
Aura, in order to earn something and be able to help with the household expenses, sells clothing of all kinds door to door. She goes out 2 or 3 days a week, walking all over the city to offer her products. Aura actually works every day because she also sells in her home where her most reliable customers come. She goes to Guayaquil each time it is necessary to purchase merchandise. She has been doing this for 5 years with good results.

This loan will be used to buy merchandise such as pants, blouses, T-shirts, and children's clothes. Aura has belonged to this communal bank through 4 loan cycles and she likes it because with these loans, her business grows each time.
 
Aura's dream is to have her house well furnished with all the conveniences.

loans.use: buy pants, blouses, T-shirts, and children's clothes to sell.

loans.name: Mercedes Monserrate

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Calle América se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar vive la señora Mercedes, tiene 37 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen 3 hijos de 15, 10  y 5  años de edad, los dos mayores  estudian en colegio y el menor  en escuela. Su esposo es albañil. 

Doña Mercedes para ganar algo y con esto poder ayudar a su esposo con los gastos que genera el hogar se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta, ella todos los días ya sea en las mañanas o en las tardes  sale a recorrer toda la ciudad ofreciendo sus productos, también vende en su  casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes más conocidos. Su mercadería  la va a comprar a  Guayaquil, Huaquillas y otras ciudades donde le venden más barato. Tiene 10 años que se dedica a esta actividad y le ha ido muy bien, con sus ganancias ella solventa ciertos gastos de estudios de sus hijos.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños. Está en el Banco Comunal hace más de 5 años  y le gusta por la ayuda que le brindan los créditos. 

Su sueño es darles lo mejor a sus pequeños hijos.
texts.en:
The Calle America Communal Bank meets every 15 days in the Montecristi region, an area known for its rich pre-colonial culture and for its artisan crafts that are recognized at the national and international levels. This is the place with the famous straw sombreros.

In this place lives Mercedes. She is 37 years old, married, and from this relationship has three children who are 15, 10, and five years old. The two older ones go to secondary school and the little one to primary school. Her husband is a bricklayer.

In order to earn something and be able to help her husband with the household expenses, Mercedes sells all types of clothes. She sells door to door every day, whether it be in the mornings or in the afternoons. She goes out to go all around the city, offering her products. She also sells out of her home, where her most well-known customers visit. She goes to purchase her merchandise in Guayaquil, Huaquillas, and other cities, where it is sold the most cheaply. She has had this business for 10 years, and it is going very well. With her earnings, she pays for certain expenses and her children's schooling.

This loan will be used to purchase more merchandise such as pants, blouses, shirts, and children's clothes. She has been in the communal bank more than five years, and she likes it because of the help that the loans giver her.

Her dream is to give the best to her little children.

loans.use: purchase pants, blouses, shirts, and children's clothes.

loans.name: Antonina

texts.en: Antonina is 28 years old and married with three children. She would like to start a small business sewing clothing. In order to do this, Antonina needs a loan to buy all the necessary items for her new business. She hopes to use her profits to expand her business. She has been a member of SPBD since 2013.

loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine, needles, threads, and fabric.

loans.name: Hussain

texts.en:
Hussain, who is 23 years old, is a single Iraqi youth client and lives with his parents. Hussain and one of his parents provide the income of the family together.

Hussain owns a small shop for selling mobile phones and accessories. He also sells CDs and DVDs of most of the local artists. After gaining enough experience while working along with his brother at a similar shop, he established his own business in 2004 and now he has one employee. His fast growth and compatible prices gave him a good reputation in the surrounding area.

Hussain is requesting a youth loan of USD 2,400. He will use this loan to buy more mobile phones to sell, as well as to redecorate and renovate his shop. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide himself better living standards.

loans.use: to buy more mobile phones to sell, as well as to redecorate and renovate his shop.

loans.name: Cherif

texts.fr:
Chérif habite au sénégal dans la régon du sud ,il est célibataire depuis plus de 6 ans il évolu dans la macanique .Il a ouvert sa propre boutique de piéces détachées dans son atelier de travail pour mieu satisfaire ses clients en cas de besoin pour piéce de rechange.
Chérif avec le crédit il compte renforcer sa boutique afin de générer plus de bénéfice pour soutenir ses parents et construire son avenir pour avoir sa propre maison.
texts.en:
Chérif is a single man who lives in southern Senegal. He became a mechanic six years ago, and he started selling spare parts out of his shop to better serve his customers. 

Chérif plans to use his loan to strengthen his business and generate more profits. This will help him to support his parents and plan for his future, eventually having a house of his own.

loans.use: to stock up on spare auto parts for resale.

loans.name: Malaetia

texts.en: Malaetia is a 36-year-old married woman with six children. She has a vegetable garden and grows different vegetables to earn a living. She has been doing this for many years. Malaetia has requested a loan to buy equipment needed for her current business. She has been a member of SPBD since 1998. With her profits, Malaetia hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy vegetable seeds, fertilizer, chemicals, gloves, and a wheelbarrow.

loans.name: Ndeye Fatou

texts.fr: Ndéye fatou est du sud sénégal agée de 42 ans veuve depuis 5 ans .Elle a 4 enfants ,2 étudiants 1 en classe de seconde ,1 en 5em seconde .Aprés le décé de son mari ,elle a ouvert un restaurant avec ses propres moyens .Elle avait bénéfié de 3 crédits antérieurs déjà rembourser au sein de l'imcec.Elle sollicite un crédit de 500 000f cfa pour développer son activité pour mieux supporter ses charges de famille et des frais de scolarité des enfants et vivre en paix avec sa famille.
texts.en:
Ndéye Fatou is from southern Senegal.  She is a 42-year-old mother of four children, two of whom attend secondary school. After the death of her husband five years ago, she opened a restaurant with her own funds. 

Having previously obtained and repaid three loans with IMCEC, she is now seeking a loan of 500,000f cfa to expand her activity. This will allow her to better support her children, pay for their tuition, and provide a peaceful lifestyle for her family.

loans.use: to stock up on supplies for her restaurant.

loans.name: Alexandra Margarita

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Calle América se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar vive la señora Alexandra, ella tiene 36 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene cuatro hijos de 10, 8, 6 y 3 años, los tres mayores estudian en escuela.  Su esposo es obrero. 

Doña Alexandra es un ama de casa que para obtener sus propios ingresos se dedica al comercio, vende ropa de todo tipo y productos de la marca Avon y Esika (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja cuatro días a la semana y su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, ella enseña su revista para que sus clientes escojan lo que necesitan, deja a crédito y cobra en dos o tres partes de acuerdo a como lo prefieran sus clientes. Entre lo que más vende están los perfumes y cremas, lleva en este negocio ya 7 años y le va muy bien.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y ropa. Lleva cuatro ciclos  en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que reciben tanto ella como sus compañeras.

Su sueño es tener una boutique o un negocio más grande.
texts.en:
The "Calle América" communal bank meets every fortnight in Montecristi, a region famous for its rich, pre-colonial culture and for its artisan products that are known both nationally and internationally.  This is where Panama hats come from.

Alexandra lives here.  She is 36 years old, married and has four children (aged ten, eight, six and three years).  The three oldest are in school and her husband is a labourer.

Alexandra is a housewife who, in order to earn her own income, also has a business.  She sells all types of clothes and Avon and Esika products (beauty products, make-up, perfumes and women's accessories).  Alexandra works four days a week, selling door to door.  She shows the catalogue to customers who can choose what they need.  They pay on credit and Alexandra collects the payments in either three or four installments, depending on each customer's preference. Her highest selling products are perfumes and creams and, after seven years with the business, it is going well for her.

Alexandra will use this loan to buy perfumes, creams, make-up and clothes.  She has been through four loan cycles with the communal bank and she likes it because of the help that she and her colleagues receive.

Alexandra's dream is to have a shop or a bigger business.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, creams, make-up and clothes.

loans.name: Dolores María

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Calle América se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar vive la señora Dolores, tiene 44 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos, dos de 13 años que son gemelos y el menor de 4 años, los dos mayores estudian en colegio. Su esposo es albañil.

Doña Dolores con la intención de ganar algo por su cuenta y con esto poder salir adelante y ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes cuando necesitan de alguna prenda o cuando lleva mercadería nueva, allí ella tiene un pequeño local más o menos surtido, aunque la mayor parte de sus ventas las realiza puerta a puerta, deja a crédito a sus clientes y cobra cada quince días. Su mercadería la va a comprar a Guayaquil cada vez que necesita. Tiene 9 años que se dedica a esta actividad y con esto ella puede solventar los gastos cuando su esposo no tiene trabajo.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños. Lleva tres ciclos  en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que siempre le dan los créditos para salir adelante.
 
Su sueño es tener un gran local.
texts.en:
The Calle América communal bank meets every 15 days in the Montecristi canton.  This canton is known for its rich pre-colonial culture and its handicrafts, which are known on a national and international level.  It is the home of the famous Panama hats.

Dolores, age 44, lives here.  She is married, and they have three children.  Two are 13 years old; they are twins.  The youngest is 4 years old.  The two older children go to school.  Her husband is a bricklayer.

In order to earn something on her own with which to be able to get ahead and help her husband with the household expenses, Dolores sells all types of clothes.  She sells door-to-door, and she also sells at her house.  

Her customers go to her house when they need a garment or when she has new merchandise.  She has a small place there that is more or less stocked, even though she makes most of her sales going from door-to-door.  She gives her customers credit, and she collects every 15 days.  

She goes to Guayaquil each time she needs to buy merchandise.  She has been doing this business activity for nine years.  With her business she is able to pay the expenses when her husband does not have work.  

She will use this loan to buy more merchandise like pants, blouses, t-shirts, and children’s clothes.  She has been in her communal bank for three cycles.  She likes the help that the loans always give in order to get ahead.  

Her dream is to have a big place.

loans.use: to buy pants, blouses, t-shirts, and children’s clothes.

loans.name: Faavae

texts.en: Faavae is a 41-year-old married woman with four children. She has a small plantation and grows taro and bananas to earn a living. She has been doing this for many years. Faavae has requested a loan to help with her children's education and to purchase new equipment to use for her business. She has been a member of SPBD since 2010. With her profits, Faavae hopes to provide for her family's everyday needs.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, chemicals, shovels and bush knives.

loans.name: Mercedes Jakeline

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Calle América se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar vive la señora Mercedes tiene 43 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos de 23, 21, 17 y 15  años, el menor estudia en colegio. Su esposo es albañil.
 
Doña Mercedes es un ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos y con esto ayudar a su marido que no gana mucho se dedica a la venta de ropa y productos de Avon (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja tres días a la semana sobre todo en las mañanas ya que a estas horas se le hace más fácil realizar sus recorridos, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada quince días. Empezó este negocio con el primer crédito que recibió de la institución.

Este crédito es para comprar ropa, perfumes, cremas y cosméticos. Lleva más de 13 años  en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los créditos son fáciles de hacer.
 
Sus sueños son tener un local y un carro para realizar sus ventas.
texts.en:
The Calle América communal bank meets every two weeks in the Montecristi canton, known for its rich pre-colonial culture  and its artisanal crafts that are known nationally and internationally. It is the home of the famous paja toquilla hats.

Here lives Mercedes. She is 43, married and has four children, aged 23, 21, 17 and 15. The youngest goes to high school. Her husband is a bricklayer.   
 
Mercedes is a housewife who in order to have her own resources and help her husband, who doesn't earn very much, decided to sell clothes and Avon products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume and women's accessories). She works three days a week, especially in the morning, because it's the easiest time to get around. She sells on credit and collects every two weeks. She started this business with the first loan she got from the institution. 

This loan is to buy clothes, perfume, creams and cosmetics. She has been in the communal bank for more than 13 years and she likes it because the loans are easy to take out.
 
Her dream is to have a locale and a car to make her sales.

loans.use: to buy clothes, perfume, creams and cosmetics.

loans.name: Angelita Del Pilar

texts.es:
Angelita es una mujer de 33 años, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa con sus tres hijos, a quienes ama y son su principal razón en la vida, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia, ya que ella es padre y madre para sus hijos; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tuvo desde muy joven para trabajar, Angelita no pudo estudiar una carrera profesional, pero le hubiera gustado mucho poder hacerlo, en sus ratos libres le gusta salir a pescar con sus hijos y en algunas de estas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Ceviche para compartir con ellos.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Angelita trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de abarrotes, ella tiene su puesto de ventas en su hogar y trabaja por un aproximado de 10 horas, Angelita se siente a gusto realizando su labor y cree que le va bien por los buenos precios y por el trato amable que brinda a sus clientes.
Angelita se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de mayor cantidad y variedad de mercadería como, arroz, azúcar, menestras, leche, detergentes y otros, de esta manera ella tendrá su negocio mejor abastecido y podrá atender a mas clientes, así pues Angelita seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de ver a sus hijos convertidos en buenos profesionales.
texts.en:
Angelita is a 33 year old woman. She lives in the city of Pucallpa with her three children. She loves them and they are her main reason for living. She is a very friendly, hard-working and enthusiastic person. All her efforts are focused on moving her family forward since she is mother and father to her children. Unfortunately, due to a lack of financial resources and the need to start working at a young age, Angelita could not study for a professional career but would like to do so. In her free time, she likes to fish with her children. Sometimes she makes a delicious ceviche for them. 
Through her own initiative and with lots of effort and dedication, Angelita works in her small business selling groceries. She has her business in her home and works for approximately 10 hours. Angelita feels comfortable with her work and she believes the business is going well because of the good prices and the kind treatment she gives to her customers. 
Angelita is very grateful for the Kiva lenders. Thanks to the help offered, she will be able to purchase a large quantity and variety of merchandise like rice, sugar, legumes, milk, detergent and other items. She will be able to better stock her business and help more customers. With these benefits, she will continue to work and strive to achieve her big dream of seeing her children become good professionals.

loans.use: purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Coumba Yéro

texts.fr:
Madame Coumba Yéro est une dame de 41 ans qui évolue dans la vente de draps de lit cousus à la main. Elle est mariée et n’a pas encore d’enfants. Elle a acquis une expérience de plus de 20 ans dans ce métier. Elle appui son mari dans la dépense du foyer. Grace au crédit, elle pourra acheter  le matériel dont elle a besoin pour travailler comme du fil de couleur différente et une variété de tissus pour la confection des draps de lit. Elle crée ses propres motifs et sa clientèle adore. Avec les bénéfices de l’activité elle pourra améliorer les conditions alimentaires de sa famille.
 Elle souhaite ouvrir une boutique de vente de prêts à porter.
texts.en:
Mrs. Coumba Yéro, age 41, is married without children. She sells hand-sewn bed sheets and has over 20 years of experience in this activity. She helps her husband with the household expenses. 

This loan will allow her to buy the supplies needed to do her work, including various shades of sewing thread and a selection of fabrics to make bed sheets. She creates her own designs, which her customers really love. 

The profits from her activity will be used to improve the family’s food situation. 

Her goal is to open a ready-to-wear store.

loans.use: to buy thread and fabrics to make bed sheets for resale.

loans.name: Tamara Group

texts.es: Grupo formado por tres socias emprendedoras una de ellas es Josefa quien tiene 31 años de edad, es casada, con un hijo menor de 8 años y se dedica desde hace tres años la venta de hielo, helados, ropa usada en su domicilio, anteriormente se dedicaba como ama de casa, eso le ayudo a aportar en la economía familiar para el sustento de su familia. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de ropa usada variada y de muy buena categoría, su sueño es comprar la ropa por paca y  vende al por mayor, Julia tiene 64 años de edad y vende comida como sopas, vaho, nacatamales los fines de semanas y María Francisca vende fritanga todos  los días en su domicilio.
texts.en:
Tamara Group is made up of three enterprising members.  One of the members is Josefa, who is 31 years old, married, and has an 8 year old son.  She has worked for three years selling ice, ice creams, and used clothing from her home.  Previously, she was a housewife.  This work helps her earn income to support her family.  

She is requesting this loan to purchase different types of used clothing in good condition.  Her dream is to purchase clothing in bales and sell it wholesale.

Julia is 64 years old and sells food such as soups, vaho, and nactamales on the weekends.  Maria Francisca sells fried foods every day from her home.

loans.use: to purchase different types of men's and women's clothing such as pants, shirts, blouses, and skirts.

loans.name: Kardiatou

texts.fr: Madame Kardiatou, une dame de 57 ans est mariée et mère de 4 enfants dont l’ainé est âgé de 25 ans et le cadet, 16. Kardiatou s’active dans la vente de légumes depuis 20 ans maintenant. Elle travaille de 6h du matin à 15h. Elle vient solliciter un crédit pour renforcer son stock et pouvoir satisfaire la demande qui est présente. Elle n’a pas de charges sinon ses besoins personnels. Elle veut diversifier son activité et entrer dans la vente de denrées alimentaires pour cela elle souhaite ouvrir une boutique avec l’appui de l’IMCEC pour un bon financement et un bon début.
texts.en:
Mrs. Kardiatou, age 57, is the married mother of four children aged 16 to 25. She has been selling vegetables for 20 years, starting at 6:00 AM and working until 3:00 PM. 

She is seeking a loan to bolster her stock of merchandise and meet customer demand. She doesn’t have any expenses other than her own personal needs.

Her goal is to diversify her activity by selling foodstuffs. To that end, she will open a store with the help of IMCEC to get started on the right foot with the proper financing.

loans.use: to stock up on vegetables for resale at the market.

loans.name: Fatimata

texts.fr: Madame Fatimata une dame de 42 ans est une femme divorcée et mère de 4 enfants, dont l’ainé a 20 ans et le cadet, 12. Elle s’active dans la vente de tissus et prêt à porter depuis maintenant 6 ans. Fatimata est une habituée du guichet car elle est à son cinquième crédit à l’IMCEC. Grace au crédit, elle pourra acheter des nouveautés pour les fêtes et pour honorer une commande. Elle n’a pas de charges et travaille pour améliorer son activité et pouvoir un jour ouvrir une boutique de prêt à porter.
texts.en:
Mrs. Fatimata, age 42, is a divorced mother of four children aged 12 to 20. She has been selling fabrics and ready-to-wear apparel for six years. 

A long-time member of the local IMCEC branch, Fatimata is seeking a 5th loan to buy new merchandise for the holidays and to fill an order.  

Fatimata doesn’t have any expenses. She works hard to improve her activity, and hopes someday to open a ready-to-wear store.

loans.use: to buy fabrics and ready-to-wear apparel for resale.

loans.name: Bongal

texts.fr:
Madame Bongal, âgée de 45 ans qui est veuve et mère de 8 en enfants dont son ainé est âgé de 22 ans et son plus jeune enfant, de 3 ans ; s’active dans la vente de poisson frais depuis maintenant 10 ans. Elle commence sa journée à 8h et fini à 14h. Elle a démarré avec fond propre et voulant voir son capital augmenter, elle vient solliciter un crédit de 150000F CFA afin de faire face aux besoins de sa clientèle.
Depuis qu’elle est veuve, Bongal s’occupe entièrement de la dépense quotidienne de sa famille.
Afin de mettre sa famille à l’aise et dans de meilleures conditions de vie, Bongal souhaite construire sa maison.
texts.en:
Mrs. Bongal is a 45-year-old widow and mother of eight children, of whom the eldest is 22 years old and the youngest 3 years old.

She has been active in the sale of fresh fish for 10 years now. She starts her day at 8 am and finishes at 2 pm.

She began her business using her own funds and as she would like to increase her working capital, she is applying for a 150,000 FCFA credit loan to meet the needs of her customers.

Since she became a widow, Bongal has been managing all of her family's daily expenses. To ensure her family's well-being and improve their living conditions, Bongal wants to build her own house.

loans.use: buy fresh fish to sell at the local market.

loans.name: Matsya Tweyambe Group

texts.en:
Scovia, aged 34 years, is married and has two children and a dependant. All her children are in school.  She lives on the outskirts of Ishaka town where she operates a bar business. She started the bar because she had little capital and yet she needed a source of income to sustain her family in terms of the basic necessities as well as tuition for the children. She works every day of the week from morning to 9pm in the night in order to break even. 

The purpose of the loan is to buy more drinks for the bar as well as retail stock so that she can earn some profits after selling. Scovia's clients come from within and around the nearby trading center. She hopes to expand her business so as to get some profit and be able to send her children to reasonable schools with good grades. 
The only challenge in her business is the rate which people default. Scovia is an honest and trustworthy person.  She says her business is profitable and she hopes to finance her loan with ease. She is also thankful for the group for supporting her in improving her household welfare by guaranteeing her for the loan.

loans.use: To buy shutters

loans.name: Leati

texts.en: Leati is a 48-year-old married woman with 6 children. She has a small plantation and grows  taro, banana, yams  to earn a living. She has been doing this for many years. Leati has requested a loan to buy materials and equipment needed for making her plantation business. She has been a member of SPBD since 2013. With her profits, Leati hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, shovels, wheel-barrel, weed killer, and a mist blower

loans.name: Sr De Coyllority Picchu Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “SR DE COYLLORITY PICCHU”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.                                                                                                                                                                                             

La socia es la Sra. Virginia ella es casada y tiene 62 años y tiene 3 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta de productos de belleza como lápiz labial, cremas y perfumes, la socia vende en forma ambulatoria desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m, la socia por medio de su negocio saca adelante a sus hijos, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los productos de belleza. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar lápiz labiales, cremas y perfumes.
 Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de transporte, negocio de venta de pescado, negocio de venta de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de comida.

 
La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the Sr De Coyllority Picchu communal bank.  This bank is located in the Cusco district, Cusco province, Cusco department.

Virginia is a member.  She is 62 years old, married, and has three children.  She works in the business of selling beauty products like lipsticks, creams, and perfumes.  She sells in an itinerant manner from 8:00 a.m. until 6:00 p.m.  Through her business she gets her children ahead.  Her dream is to have a place where she is able to sell her beauty products.  She is requesting the loan to buy lipsticks, creams, and perfumes.

The other members’ businesses are transportation, selling fish, a store selling groceries, and selling food.

The member is grateful to those who form part of this dream through this means.  She pledges to makes her payments during the established time frame.

loans.use: to buy lipstick, creams, and perfumes.

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr: Fatou habite au sénégal dans la région du sud , elle est agée de 51 ans .Elle a 2 enfants l'ainé est en Angleterre et le second est à Dakar . Fatou depuis 2 ans elle travaille dans l'élevage de pouler de chaire qui marche trés bien avec elle.Elle a déjà remboursé son premier crédit antérieurs de 150 000f au sein de l'imcec.Elle achete des aliments,des poussins dans la meme ville.Elle démare sa journée de 07h à 19h ,les poussins sont alimentés quatre fois dans la journée pour une période de 2 mois.Elle a comme ambition de faire un grand poulailler dans l'avenir.
texts.en: Fatou lives in the southern region of Senegal. She is 51 years old with two children. Her eldest child is in England, and the youngest is in Dakar. Fatou has been working raising poultry for the last two years, which works very well for her. She has already repaid her previous loan of 150,000 XOF to UIMCEC. She buys food and the chicks in the same town. She begins her work day at 7 AM and works until 7 PM. The chicks are fed four times a day for two months. Her ambition is to have a great chicken coop in the future.

loans.use: to buy chicks for her poultry business.

loans.name: Abibou

texts.fr:
Abibou agé de 50 ans , il a 5 enfants :3 garçons et 2 filles son fils ainé est dans le service militaire deux sont dans l'école . Il est employé dans une boulangerie depuis de plus 15 ans .Avec imcec , il a bénéfié d'un crédit 400 000f qu'il a remboursé pour achater un terrain dans sa régions au nord . 
Il sollicite un crédit de 500 000f pour acheter du ciments pour confectionner les briques de démarage de la constructions de sa maison . Il souhaite dans l'avenir construire toute sa maison à l'aide l'u imcec .
texts.en:
Abibou, age 50, is the father of five children, three boys and two girls. His eldest son is in the military, and two of the other children go to school. Abibou has been working in a bakery for over 15 years. He obtained a 400,000F loan with U-IMCEC to buy some land in the northern region where he lives. This loan has been repaid. 

He is now seeking a loan of 500,000F to buy concrete. He will use it to make bricks to start building a house. He hopes that the financial support he receives from U-IMCEC will allow him to finish construction work on his house.

loans.use: to buy concrete to build his house.

loans.name: Emprendamos El Futuro Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “EMPRENDAMOS EL FUTURO”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.                                                                                                                                                                                             

La socia es la Sra. Ambrocia ella es conviviente y tiene 52 años y tiene 1 hijo; La socia trabaja en su negocio de librería, la socia vende útiles de escritorio, útiles escolares,lapiceros,cuadernos entre otros, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 9:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 7 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, la socia por medio de este negocio saca adelante a su hijo, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de librería. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar útiles escolares, cuadernos, borradores y lapiceros.
 Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de artesanía, negocio de tienda de abarrotes, negocio de venta internet y negocio de restaurant.

 
La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The community bank Empredamos el Futuro is located in the Cusco district in the province and department of Cusco.

Ambrocia is a member of the group.  She is 52 years old, married, and has one child.  She works at her bookstore selling writing supplies, school supplies, pens, notebooks, and other items.  She works from 8:00am until 9:00pm.  She has had this business for seven years and it is going very well.  Ambrocia's business helped her son succeed.  Her dream is to expand her bookstore.  She is requesting this loan to purchase school supplies, notebooks, erasers, and pens.  

The other members work selling crafts, at a grocery store, in internet sales, and at a restaurant.  

Ambrocia is grateful to everyone who is a part of her dream.  She promises to make her repayments according to the established schedule.

loans.use: to purchase school supplies, notebooks, erasers, and pens.

loans.name: Mujeres Transformadas Group

texts.es: Este es un grupo formado por cuatro socias microempresarias una de ellas es Cenelia tiene 44 años de edad, soltera que desde hace tres años vende bisuterías, platanitos, cajetas, refrescos naturales, frutas frescas en su domicilio. Anteriormente vendía carne de cerdo ambulante, actualmente quiere invertir en productos de pulperías en menor escala como la compra de granos básicos como arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceite, papel higiénico, sal, sopas magis, pan, huevos, frijoles cocidos, etc. Jennifer tiene 21 años de edad y su negocio es que tiene una pulpería en su domicilio, Orfilia vende golosinas y pan y María tiene 66 años de edad y vende gaseosas, chiverías etc.
texts.en:
This is a group that is comprised of four small businesswomen.  Cenelia is one of them.  She is 44 years old and single.  For three years she has been selling costume jewelry, plantain chips, “cajetas” [similar to caramel], natural soft drinks, and fresh fruit at her house.

She previously sold pork in an itinerant manner.  She now wants to invest in grocery store products on a small scale.  She will buy things like basic grains, rice, beans, sugar, oil, toilet paper, salt, soups, corn, bread, eggs, and cooked beans, etc.

Jennifer, age 21, has a grocery store business at her house.  Orfilia sells sweets and bread.  María, age 66, sells soft drinks and snacks, etc.

loans.use: to buy grocery store type products.

loans.name: Aissata

texts.fr: Madame Aissata est une dame âgée de 37 ans qui évolue dans le commerce de légumes ou elle a acquis une expérience de 15 ans. Aissata est mariée et mère de 4enfants dont l’ainé a 11 ans et le plus jeune, 3 ans. Depuis le bas âge, elle a toujours adoré faire du commerce et maintenant son vœux s’est réalisé. Grace au bénéfice reçu, elle gère ses propres charges personnelles et souhaite diversifier ses revenus en ouvrant une boutique de vente de prêt à porter tel est son projet pour l’avenir.
texts.en:
Mrs. Aissata, age 37, has been selling vegetables for the past 15 years. She is the married mother of four children aged 3 to 11. She developed a passion for commerce at a young age, and her dream has now come true. 

This financial support allows her to manage her own personal expenses. She plans to diversify her income by opening a ready-to-wear store. This is her goal for the future.

loans.use: to buy vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Abraham Group

texts.es: Este grupo está formado por tres socias experimentadas una de ellas es Nora María tiene 48 años de edad, madre soltera tiene siete hijos todos mayores de edad solamente un hijo que tiene bajo su responsabilidad. Tiene cinco años que se dedica a la venta de chatarra  todos los días ambulantes anteriormente vendia comida  y al destace de cerdo, tiene 10 años que la institución le brinda financiamiento ha demostrado responsabilidad y puntualidad en  sus pagos, su hijo de 20 años es el que le ayuda en el negocio y un hermano de la socia que  le paga salario. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de chatarras en toda la capital, Heriberta tiene 45 años y vende cemento, lubricantes, y ropa nueva, Edda su edad es de 58 años y vende ropa, nacatamales y sopas.
texts.en: This group has three experienced members. One of them is Nora María. She is 38 years old. She is a single mother with seven children. All of them except for one are older in age. One son is still under her responsibility. For five years, she has sold scraps every day through a mobile business. Previously, she sold food and carved pork. For ten years, the institution has provided financing. She has demonstrated responsibility and punctuality with her payments. Her 20 year old son helps her with her business and she pays a salary to her brother. The loan will be invested in the purchase of scraps from all over the capital. Heriberta is 45 years old and she sells cement, lubricants and new clothes. Edda is 58 years old and she sells clothing, nacatamales (Nicaraguan tamales) and soups.

loans.use: invest in the purchase of scraps.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in the purchase of beef, chicken, sausages, basic grains like rice, beans, sugar, oils and soups, and various cosmetics like cologne, perfume, and over the counter medicines.

loans.name: Jairo Santiago

texts.es: Jairo es un microempresario de éxito con 35 años de edad, casado, con tres hijos menores de edad de 2, 9 y 12 años respectivamente, desde hace dos años su negocio es de brindar servicios de música disco a eventos de cumpleaños, bodas, bautismo, comuniones, etc. el crédito que solicita es para levantar un muro perimetral en su casa de habitación esto es con el fin de brindar mejor seguridad a su familia e hijos. Los materiales a adquirir son piedras canteras, bloques, cemento, hierro, tablas de pinos, arena, piedrín, pago de mano de obras etc.
texts.en: Jairo is a 35 year old successful micro-business man. He is married and has 3 minor children, aged 2, 9 and 12. For two years, his business has been offering disk jockey services for events such as birthday parties, weddings, baptism, first communions, etc. The loan he is asking for is to put up an outside wall at his house. This is to offer more security for his family and children. The materials he will acquire are limestone, blocks, cement, iron rods, pine boards, sand, to pay for labor costs, etc.

loans.use: to buy construction materials such as limestone, blocks, cement, iron rods, pine boards, gravel and to pay for labor costs.

loans.name: Delicias Del Valle Group

texts.es: Grupo formado por tres socias emprendedoras de éxitos una de ellas es María José tiene 28 años de edad, soltera hace 6 meses vende cosméticos de la Avon, anteriormente era trabajadora de la zona franca como operaria, el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de cosméticos como crema para el cuerpo, crema para la facial, crema para las manos, lociones, perfumen de dama, perfume de varón, desodorantes, delineadores, pinturas de uñas, pinturas de labios, champo etc. Antonia tiene 45 años de edad y vende ropa usada y Yeri tiene 26 años de edad y vende refrescos naturales y repostería.
texts.en: This group is made up of three enterprising and successful members. One of them is María José. She is 28 years old, single and has been selling Avon cosmetics for 6 months. Previously, she worked in the free trade zone as a laborer. She will invest the loan in buying cosmetics such as body cream, facial cream, hand cream, lotions, women's perfume, men's cologne, eye liners, lipsticks, shampoo, etc. Antonia is 45 years old and she sells used clothing, and Yeri is 26 and sells natural drinks and pastries.

loans.use: to invest in buying cosmetics such as body creams, facial creams, hand creams,  lotions, women's perfumes, men's cologne, deodorants, eyeliners, nail polish, lipsticks, shampoo, etc.

loans.name: Maria Amanda

texts.es: María Amanda es una emprendedora de éxito tiene 32 años de edad, casada, con dos hijos menores de 14 y 4 años de edad respectivamente. Desde hace cinco años tiene un Cyber café ubicado en su domicilio, quien su compañero y ella atienden el negocio, a parte del Cyber vende productos de librerías y servicio de fotocopias. Anteriormente trabajaba a una empresa privada, el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de materiales de librería como lapiceros, crayolas, borradores, cartulinas, folder tamaño carta, folder tamaño legal, cuadernos universitarios etc.
texts.en:
María Amanda is a successful entrepreneur. She is 32 years old, married, and has two children aged 14 and 4. 

For five years now she and her partner have run an Internet café which is located in her home. In addition to the internet, she sells office and school supplies and provides a photocopying service. 

She used to work for a private company.

The loan will be used to buy office and school supplies such as pens, crayons, erasers, construction paper, letter-sized file folders, legal-sized file folders, university notebooks, etc.

loans.use: to buy office and school supplies such as pens, crayons, erasers, construction paper, letter-sized file folders, legal-sized file folders, university notebooks etc.

loans.name: Marenco Group

texts.es: Este grupo está formado por tres socios emprendedores una de ellas es Patricia  tiene 28 años de edad, es acompañada y hace 8 años se dedica a la costura teniendo en su casa un  pequeño taller de costura, ella elabora ropa a  la medida y en series como vestidos, chores, faldas, camisas etc. el crédito lo  invertirá en la compra de materia prima como telas maxis, dracon, hilos, sedinas, encajes etc. Josefa tiene 59 años de edad y también tiene un taller de costura en su domicilio y Henry tiene una pulpería en su domicilio y tiene 28 años de edad.
texts.en:
This group is comprised of three enterprising members.  

Patricia, age 28, is one of them.  She has been in a relationship for eight years.  She is a seamstress, and she has a small shop in her house.  She makes tailor-made clothes and different types like dresses, shorts, skirts, and shirts, etc.  She will use the loan to buy raw material like maxi fabrics, Dacron, thread, satin, and lace, etc.

Josefa, age 59, also has a seamstress shop at her house.  Henry, age 28, has a grocery store at his house.

loans.use: to buy raw material like maxi fabrics, Dacron, thread, satin, and lace, etc.

loans.name: Victoria Group

texts.es: Grupo formado por tres socios emprendedores una de ellas es María tiene 62 años de edad y hace más de 20 años vende comida, golosinas en un kiosco de un hospital de la localidad, es casada, tiene un  hijo mayor que es la que le ayuda en el negocio, de estar en Adim tiene 7 años de estar laborando ante la institución cumpliendo sus compromisos de pagos, el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de productos como el arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceite, plátano, carme de res, carne de pollo, tortillas, salsa de tomate, crema, perecederos etc. Lylliam tiene 58 años  vende cosméticos de la Avon y Roberto tiene 39 años de edad vende calculadoras, radios, baterías, relojes etc.
texts.en: The Victoria group is made up of three enterprising and hard-working members. One of them is Maria. She is 62 and for more than 20 years, she has sold food and sweets in a hospital kiosk in the city. She is married, and has a grown son who helps her with her business. She has been working with ADIM for seven years, making her payments on time. She will invest the loan in purchasing goods like rice, beans, sugar, oil, bananas, beef, chicken, tortillas, tomato salsa, cream, perishable goods, and more. Lilliam, 58, sells Avon cosmetics and Roberto, 39, sells calculators, radios, batteries, clocks, etc.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs to sell.

loans.name: Amor Al Trabajo Group

texts.es: Grupo está formado por tres socios emprendedores una de ellas es Karla tiene 32 años de edad, casada, desde hace un año tiene una pulpería en su domicilio, inicio como comerciante y con las ganancias fue guardando para compra de productos de la pulperías. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de granos como arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceite, carne de res, carne de pollo, productos lácteos, jabón de baños, jabón de lavar ropa, cafés solubles, etc. Rosa hace y vende nacatamales tiene 44 años de edad y José compra y vende cosechas de carbón.
texts.en: This group is made up of three enterprising members. One of them is Karla. She is 32 and married. She has had a small grocery store in her home for a year now. She started as a businesswoman, and then she saved her earnings to buy grocery products. She will invest the loan in purchasing rice, beans, sugar, oil, beef, chicken, dairy products, bath soap, laundry soap, instant coffee, and more. Rosa,44, makes and sells nacatamales and José buys and sells charcoal.

loans.use: to buy products for her grocery store.

loans.name: Ada Luz

texts.es: Microempresaria de éxito es Ada Luz mujer soltera con cuatro hijos y 31 años de edad, desde hace dos años se dedica a la venta de ropa usada, tiene tres años de ser cliente de la institución, como buena cliente en grupos solidarios fue promovida a la metodología individual porque su negocio a reflejado crecimiento en el mismo. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de pacas mixtas para la comercialización.
texts.en: A successful micro-businessowner, Ada Luz, 31, is a single woman with four children. She has worked selling used clothing for two years. She has been working with the institution for three years. As a good client in solidarity groups, she was moved to the individual track because her business grew. She will use the loan to buy a bale of assorted clothing to sell.

loans.use: to buy a bale of assorted clothing to sell.

loans.name: Arlin Del Socorro

texts.es: Arlin es una microempresaria de éxitos ella es una mujer casada, tiene 32 años de edad, desde hace 3 años vende ropa usada en su domicilio y ambulante, tiene de ser cliente de la institución dos años, el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de ropa nueva como pantalón de varón, pantalón de dama, trajes para niños, licras para dama y niñas etc.
texts.en:
Arlin is a successful small businessperson. She is married, 32 years old, and for three years has sold used clothing from her home and as a street vendor. 

She has been a client of the institution for two years. She will use the loan to buy new clothing such as men's and women's pants, baby outfits, and spandex for women and children.

loans.use: To buy new clothing such as men's and women's pants, children's outfits and spandex for women and children.

loans.name: La Propuesta  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal La Propuesta está formado por 7 mujeres luchadoras que laboran en diferentes actividades las mismas que les permiten mejorar su estabilidad económica, son mujeres alegres, carismáticas que aun mantienen viva su cultura y tradiciones. Viven por la parroquia de Cumbe en Cuenca, este lugar se encuentra rodeado de montañas de una belleza sin igual, su gente se dedica a los trabajos del campo como es la crianza de animales o la agricultura y muchos laboran en la ciudad ejerciendo diferentes actividades economías.

Un de las socias de este grupo es la Señora Liliana, tiene 25 años, es casada y ha concebido un hijo de 2 años de edad, su esposo es profesional y labora en un taller de mecánica industrial, la casa en la que viven es propia.

Doña Liliana se dedica a los quehaceres de su hogar y al cuidado de su hijo, pero para ayudarle a su esposo a solventar los gastos del hogar cría y vende cerdos, cuyes y gallinas, también se dedica a la agricultura y lo que cosecha es para el consumo de su hogar y también  vende en su comunidad. 

Su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de una cocineta para iniciar con el negocio de venta de comida rápida.

Su meta es crecer en este negocio que está iniciando.
texts.en:
The communal bank La Propuesta is made up of 7 determined women that work in different activities that allow them to improve their economic stability.  They are cheerful, charismatic women who still keep their culture and traditions alive.  They live around the Cumbe parish in Cuenca.  This place is surrounded by mountains of unparalleled beauty.  Its people dedicate themselves to work in the fields such as raising animals or agriculture and many work in the city practicing different economic activities.

One of the members of this group is Liliana.  She is 25 years old, married and has conceived a child who is 2 years old.  Her husband is a professional and works in an industrial mechanic workshop.  The house that they live in is their own.

Liliana devotes herself to the household chores and to the care of her child but in order to help her husband cover the household expenses she raises and sells pigs, guinea pigs and chickens.  She also works in agriculture and what she harvests is for household consumption and also for sale in the community. 

She is going to invest her loan in the purchase of a small stove in order to begin with the business of selling fast food. 

Her goal is to grow in this business that she is starting.

loans.use: to buy a small stove.

loans.name: Elba Maria

texts.es: Elba María es una microempresaria de éxito desde hace dos años su negocio es la venta de ropa nueva, tiene 30 años de edad, es casada. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de ropa nueva como pantalones de varones, camisas tricotextil, perfume la coste etc.
texts.en: Elba María is a successful micro-businesswoman. She has sold new clothing for two years. She is 30 years old and married. She will use the loan to buy new clothing like men's pants, Tricotextil shirts, Lacoste perfume, etc.

loans.use: to buy new clothing like men's pants, Tricotextil shirts, Lacoste perfume, etc.

loans.name: Corazón De Jesús  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Corazón de Jesús está formado por 12 socias y 1 socio quienes laboran a diario en diferentes actividades económicas que son la fuente de ingresos para sus hogares, son de un corazón noble, carismático y aun mantienen viva su cultura y tradiciones de sus padres. Viven por la parroquia del Valle en Cuenca, este lugar día a día va cree económicamente gracias al trabajo de su población, su principal actividad económica es la agricultura, la crianza de animales y comercio, también por las remesas que algunos reciben de sus familiares del extranjero.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Sandra tiene 23 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido dos hijos, su primer hijo tiene 6 años y está estudiando en una escuelita de la ciudad, su segundo hijo pasa en casa ya que tiene 2 años de edad. Su esposo labora como empleado privado, no tienen casa propia por lo que vive en casa de sus suegros compartiendo los gastos de la casa.

Doña Sandra se dedica a las tareas de su casa y a la vez tiene un trabajo fijo, trabaja en un lugar donde elaboran de cielos rasos, labora de lunes a viernes desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 5 de la tarde. En el tiempo que tiene libre desea  dedicarse crianza de animales. 

Su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de un becerro y  material de construcción para seguir construyendo su casa.

Su meta es de terminar  su casa. 

La foto pequeña es de dos socias que no pudieron estar presentes cuando se tomo la foto del grupo.
texts.en:
The communal bank Corazón de Jesús (Heart of Jesus) is made up of 13 members, 12 women and one man. They work every day in different jobs that are the source of income for their homes. They are of noble heart, charismatic, and they still maintain the culture and traditions of their parents. They live in Valle Parish in Cuenca. This place grows economically day after day thanks to the work of its people. The main economic activity is agriculture, raising animals, and trade, as well as the remittances that some receive from their families abroad. 

One member of this group is Sandra. She is 23, married, and has two children. Her first child is six years old and is studying at a school in the city. Her second child stays at home, since he is two. Her husband works as a private employee. They do not have their own home, so they live with her in-laws, sharing household expenses. Sandra cares for the home and has fixed employment. She works in a place where they make drop ceilings. She works Monday through Friday from eight in the morning until five in the afternoon. She wants to work raising animals in her free time. She will use her loan to buy a young cow and construction materials for continue building her house. Her goal is to finish her house.

The small photo is of two members who couldn't be there when the group photo was taken.

loans.use: to buy a young cow and construction materials.

loans.name: Madjiguene

texts.fr:
Madjiguène agée de 35 ans célibataire avec un enfant depuis plus de 10 ans elle est dans le commerce de produits cosmétiques,avec cette activité elle a supporté les frais de sa formation en patisserie pendant 2 ans .
Madjiguène avait bénéfié d'un crédit 100 000f sein de l'u imcec qu'elle a remboursé sans difficultée.Avec ce crédit elle veut se lancer dans son métier de formation.Elle a comme ambition d'ouvrir une fast-food pour expérimenter son savoir .
texts.en:
Madjiguène, age 35, is a single mother of one. She has been selling cosmetic products for over ten years, and this activity has allowed her to support the cost of training as a pastry maker for two years. 

Madjiguène has previously obtained a loan of 100,000F with U-IMCEC, which she has since repaid without difficulty. 

She will use this new loan to launch a new career as a pastry maker. Her goal is to open a fast-food shop where she could experiment with her skills and knowledge.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, eggs, etc. for pastry making.

loans.name: El Hadji Mouhamadou

texts.fr: Monsieur El Hadji Mouhamadou vit au Sénégal. Il est couturier et a commencé ce métier très tôt, à bas âge, plus précisément  à l’âge de 12 ans. Il est marié,  père de famille  et  supporte les charges de nourriture de sa famille, de factures d’électricité, de transport et de salaire pour son employé. Il est sociétaire  à l’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC  ou il a remboursé  deux crédits antérieurs. De Nouveau, il sollicite un crédit d’un montant de 250.000 francs CFA prévu  pour  acheter des tissus  a confectionner et qui seront destinés a la vente. Ce financement pourra lui permettre par conséquent d’augmenter les bénéfices que lui génère son activité  et aussi d’accroitre ses économies afin de pouvoir acquérir dans le futur d’autres machines a coudre plus modernes et plus  performantes. Dans le futur, il  souhaiterait élargir davantage son activité  de couturier un peu partout dans la  sous-région (mali, Benin…) a travers l’exposition de ses modèles.
texts.en:
Mr. El Hadji Mouhamadou lives in Senegal.  He is a tailor who began work in his field at the age of 12.  He is married and is the head of his household, providing for the needs of his family, electric bills, and transportation, as well as the salary for his employees.  He is a member of a UIMCEC group, where he has repaid his two previous loans. 

Currently, he is asking for a loan of 250,000 francs (CFA) for the purpose of buying fabric which he will sew for subsequent resale.  This will enable him to increase his profits and build his savings so that he will be able to purchase more modern and higher-performance sewing machines in the future.

Eventually, he would like to further expand his sewing business to various locations in the region (Mali, Benin…) through exposition of his work.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics for sewing and subsequent resale.

loans.name: Khady

texts.fr: Madame Khady habite au Sénégal. C’est une femme marié qui évolue dans le secteur  du commerce depuis 2005. Elle exerce l’activité de  vente de légumes. Elle est membre de l’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC où elle sollicite un prêt d’un montant de 500.000 francs CFA afin d’augmenter son fond de roulement.  Son intention est d’utiliser son financement  pour acheter des  légumes  destinés  à la vente. L’accroissement de ses bénéfices  à travers ce financement  lui permettra d’améliorer les conditions alimentaires  de sa famille et de renforcer  ses  économies afin  de  faire face aux besoins imprévus. Son futur projet est d’acquérir une boutique pour y  installer ses produits.
texts.en:
Mrs. Khady is a married woman who lives in Senegal. She has been working in trade since 2005, and is currently selling vegetables. She is a member of the local U-IMCEC branch where she is seeking a loan of 500,000 francs CFA to strengthen her working capital. She plans to use the funds to stock up on vegetables for resale. 

The additional profits earned through this funding will help her to improve her family’s food situation and to bolster her savings in case of unexpected circumstances. Her goal for the future is to open a store to sell her merchandise.

loans.use: to buy vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Dina

texts.es:
La  socia pertenece al banco comunal “SILKINCHANY” el banco se encuentra ubicado en la comunidad de Angostura, en la Provincia de Cusco y Departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Dina; la socia continua dedicandose al reciclaje,la socia cuenta con una carreta donde pone todas las botellas de plastico,metales,los cuales va recolectando,la socia lleva años en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia a su negocio,la socia solicita el credito para la compra de botellas de plastico para su negocio.


La socia se siente agradecida por el credito otorgado y se compromte a cumplir con sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the “SILKINCHANY” communal bank, located in the Angostura community, in the province of Cusco, Cusco Department. 

This is Mrs. Dina.  She continues to work in the recycling business.  She has a wagon that she uses to gather plastic bottles and metal that she collects throughout her community.  She has been in this business for years and it is going well for her, thanks to the effort that she puts into it every day.  She is asking for a loan to buy plastic bottles for her business.  

She is grateful for the loan that is being offered and promises to make her payments according to the agreed-upon schedule.

loans.use: buy plastic bottles for her business.

loans.name: Lesina
