Par conséquent, l’amélioration de ses gains lui permettra de  continuer de participer dans la gestion des charges familiales mais aussi   d’épargner  de l’argent. Son projet dans le futur s’inscrit dans le cadre de son désir de développer  davantage son  activité.
texts.en:
Miss Oulimata lives in Senegal. For the past two years this young woman managed to meet her personal needs through her activity as a seamstress. Her concern is about buying fabric with which she makes clothes for sale.

She is a member at one of the the U-IMCEC branches where she is requesting a loan of 100,000 CFA francs. She plans to use this loan to buy fabric which will increase the choice of ready-to-wear clothing she can offer her customers.

Therefore improving earnings allows her to continue to participate in managing family responsibilities but also to save money. Projects for the future stem from her wish to expand her business activities.

loans.use: Buy fabric to make clothing and to resell

loans.name: Oumar Hamady

texts.fr:
Monsieur Oumar Hamady un homme de 51 ans est un grand éleveur qui exerce le métier depuis 3 ans. Il est marié et père de 11 enfants dont l’ainé a 18 ans et le cadet, un bébé de 1 mois.
Son activité consiste à acheter du bétail, à l’engraisser pendant 8 à 9mois, et à le revendre après. Avec le crédit, il peut désormais augmenter le nombre de bêtes dans son enclos.
Monsieur Oumar Hamady gère sa dépense quotidienne et veille à l’éducation de ses enfants. Il désirerait ouvrir un jour, un verger pour y faire des cultures maraichères.
texts.en: Oumar Hamady, a 51-year-old man, is a large livestock breeder who has been in this line of work for 3 years. He is married and the father of 11 children, the eldest of whom is 18 years old and the youngest, a 1-month-old baby. His business consists of buying oxen which he fattens during 8 or 9 months and then resells. With this loan, he will be able to increase the amount of livestock in his pen. Oumar Hamady manages his daily expenditures and makes sure that his children get an education. One day, he would like to start an orchard and engage in market gardening.

loans.use: to buy oxen for resale.

loans.name: Houlèye

texts.fr:
Madame Houlèye, une dame de 37 ans est mariée et mère de 4 enfants dont l’ainé est âgée de 18 ans et le cadet, 8 ans. Elle a une expérience de 18 ans car elle a très tôt démarré dans cette activité. Avec le crédit de 150000F CFA, elle pourra se ravitailler en produits divers qu’elle va revendre sans tarder car le plus souvent c’est des commandes qu’elle honore. 
Elle s’occupe des besoins alimentaires de sa famille
La dame Houlèye a un projet qui lui tient à cœur et elle compte le réaliser avec l’appui d’une Institution financière comme IMCEC : celui de créer une entreprise de transport à son nom qui interviendrait un peu partout dans le pays.
texts.en:
Mrs. Houlèye, age 37, is a married mother to four children aged 8 to 18. She sells food products, and she boasts 18 years of experience in her activity, having started at a young age. She provides for her family’s food needs.

She will use her loan of 150,000F CFA to stock up on various merchandise to be sold fairly quickly. Her business typically consists of filling orders. 

Houlèye has a goal, which she hopes to be able to achieve with the support of a MFI such as IMCEC: to start a transportation company in her own name to provide services everywhere in the country.

loans.use: to buy various food products for resale.

loans.name: Adama

texts.fr:
Il est âgé de 41 ans et s’active dans la vente de pain et cela depuis 5 ans déjà. Il s’appelle Adama, il est marié et père de 5 enfants âgé de 14 ans pour l’ainé et de juste 6 mois pour le cadet. Il vient pour la seconde fois solliciter un crédit de 300000F CFA pour améliorer son commerce. Il pourra acheter de la farine et des ingrédients pour la fabrication de pain. C’est à partir des bénéfices qu’il tire sa dépense quotidienne et s’occupe de son foyer. 
Dans l’avenir, il aimerait ouvrir une boulangerie moderne mais aussi vendre des habits prêts à porter.
texts.en: Adama is 41 years old and has been selling bread for 5 years. He is married and the father of 5 children, the eldest of whom is 14 years old and the youngest, just 6 months. He is requesting a loan, for the second time, of 300 000 francs with which to improve his business. He will be able to buy flour and other ingredients with which to make bread. He covers his daily expenses and takes care of his household using his profits. In the future, he would like to open a modern bakery and also sell ready-to-wear clothing.

loans.use: to buy flour and other ingredients with which to make bread for resale.

loans.name: Bineta

texts.fr: Madame Bineta une dame de 43 ans, marié et mère de 3 enfants dont l’ainé a 25 ans et le cadet, 15 ans. Elle évolue dans le commerce depuis 10 ans et a embrassé le métier par amour. Elle commence sa journée à 10h et fini à 14h de l’après-midi. Elle appuie son mari dans la dépense quotidienne avec les bénéfices récoltés. Et avec une épargne régulière elle pourra entamer les travaux de construction de sa maison pour donner du confort et le bien être à sa famille.
texts.en:
Mrs. Bineta is a 43-year-old lady, married and mother of three children, of whom the eldest is 25 and the youngest 15 years old.

She has been active in retail commerce for 10 years and has embraced the profession as a labor of love. She starts her day at 10 am and finishes at 2 in the afternoon. With the profits she supports her husband in managing daily expenditures.

Regular savings will enable her to begin construction of her house, to bring comfort and well-being to her family.

loans.use: buy ready-to-wear clothes for resale

loans.name: Aissata Oumar

texts.fr:
Madame Aissata Oumar une dame de 36 ans, évolue dans la vente de prêt à porter  ou elle a acquis une expérience de 2 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 5 enfants. Elle a ouvert un compte à l’IMCEC afin de pouvoir accéder au crédit et  améliorer son commerce qui est à ses débuts. Elle gère ses propres charges et appuie de temps en temps dans la gestion de la dépense quotidienne, ce qui n’est pas pour autant une obligation.
Elle rêve dans l’avenir, d’ouvrir une boutique d’alimentation générale si elle a un bon chiffre d’affaire et l’aide d’IMCEC financièrement.
texts.en: Aissata Oumar is a 36-year-old woman. She sells ready-to-wear clothing and has 2 years experience. She is married and the mother of 5 children. She has opened an account at UIMCEC in order to gain access to credit and improve her business, which is just beginning. She manages her own expenses and occasionally helps out with the daily expenditures, even though it is not an obligation. She dreams of one day opening a grocery shop, if she has a successful turnover and financial support from UIMCEC.

loans.use: to buy ready-to-wear clothing for resale.

loans.name: Gpf Fedde Daribe Matam Group

texts.fr:
Le GPF Feede Daribe Matam regroupe 5 femmes qui ont des liens de parenté entre elles et qui font toute du commerce.
La responsable s’appelle Dieynaba, âgée de 49 ans, mariée et mère de 6 enfants. Elle fait de la vente de produits divers : habillement, chaussures, cosmétiques. Elle a une expérience de 3 ans dans ce domaine et  travaille de 10h à 12h. Elle n’a pas de charges qui l’encombrent sinon ses besoins personnels.
Dieynaba veut un jour, ouvrir une boutique de vente de prêt à porter.
texts.en:
The group GPF Feede Daribe Matam has five women members who are all relatives and who work in business.
The leader of the group, Dieynaba is 49 years old, married and has six children. She has a business of selling a variety of products: clothing, shoes and cosmetics. She has been in business for the past three years and works from 10am to 12 noon. She doesn't have the burden of a lot of expenses, just her own personal needs.
Dieynaba would like to one day open her own store selling ready-to-wear clothing.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of products for resale: cosmetics, shoes and clothing.

loans.name: Kelegna Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe  est constitué de 4 femmes toutes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 43 ans et 5 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles traditionnelles élargies avec leurs maris, coépouses, frères et fils dans le quartier Massablacoura de la ville de Bougouni. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles ont adhéré à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur huitième  prêt. Les sept précédents prêts ont été correctement remboursés. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de céréales à travers de ROUTIE, elle est la première femme de la gauche vers la droite. Elle fait l’achat vente de céréales et compte acheter avec son  prêt, 1500Kg de mais avec les paysans producteurs. Elle effectue ses ventes au marché  et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle composée essentiellement de femmes. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 35.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
This group is made up of 4 women who are all married and have an average age of 43 and, on average, 5 children. They live in traditional, extended families with their husbands, co-spouses, brothers and sons in the district of Massablacoura, in Bougouni town. They got to know each other through neighbourly and professional relationships, and friendships. They joined the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution in order to strengthen their financial capacity, so that they could better do business, and are on their 8th loan. The seven previous loans have been properly repaid.

This group of women sells cereals via Routie. She is on the far left in the picture. She buys and sells cereals and plans to use her loan to buy 1500 kgs of corn from the farmers. She makes her sales at the market and at home, for cash or credit, to a retail clientèle composed mainly of women. She expects to make an average monthly profit of 35 000 francs, part of which will be reinvested in her business and part of which will be used to repay the loan.

loans.use: to buy cereals.

loans.name: Ndomo

texts.fr:
Agée de 65 ans, madame Ndomo, s’active dans la vente de thiakry (qui est un aliment dérivé du mil et qui se consomme avec du lait caillé. Cela fait maintenant 3 ans qu’elle évolue dans ce domaine. Elle vient solliciter un crédit de cent mille francs afin de pouvoir acheter le mil, le transformer et acheter aussi les ingrédients qui vont avec ce met. 
Elle gère ses propres charges et appuie quand elle le  désire à la dépense quotidienne de la famille, car elle a une grande famille et ne peut pas rester les bras croisés. Elle est âgée mais s’active pour ne pas rester sédentaire.
texts.en:
Mrs. Ndomo is 65 years old and has a business selling thiakry (food made from millet mixed with curdled milk). She has been working in this field for the past three years. She is requesting a loan of 100,000 CFA francs to purchase millet to then make into thiakry and to purchase the other ingredients necessary.
She takes care of her own personal expenses and when she's able contributes to her family's expenses. Since she has a large family, she refuses to stay idle. She's aging, but doesn't want to be sedentary.

loans.use: to purchase millet to make thiakry and for resale

loans.name: Kadiatou

texts.fr:
Madame Kadiatou est une femme mariée de 46 ans et mère de 5 enfants. Elle vit avec son époux et se enfants  dans le quartier Torakabougou de Bougouni. 
Ayant abandonnée l’école en classe de 5ème année fondamentale (système scolaire malien), elle décida de s'intéresser aux  activités génératrices de revenus.
C’est ainsi qu’elle décida de suivre sa sœur pour apprendre l’activité d’achat et de vente des congélateurs. Avec une expérience de plus de 15 ans, elle maitrise son activité dans laquelle est elle est très appréciée et sollicitée. 
Elle est à son deuxième prêt avec Soro Yiriwaso et le prêt précédent a été bien remboursé. 
C’est dans le cadre de l’élargissement de ses activités, qu’elle décida de prendre ce nouveau prêt avec Soro Yiriwaso pour acheter  3 congélateurs.
 Elle s’approvisionne à Lomé. Ses congélateurs sont vendus dans sa boutique. Sa clientèle est mixte
Elle compte réalisé  avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 100 000 FCFA 
Avec ce bénéfice elle envisage agrandir son entreprise.
texts.en:
Mrs. Kadiatou is a 46-year-old woman, married and mother of five children. She lives with her ​​husband and children in the Torakabougou neighborhood of Bougouni.

After she quit school in her fifth year of fundamental schooling (Malian school system), she decided to focus on income-generating activities and followed her sister in learning the business of buying and selling freezers. With over 15 years' experience, she now masters the activity in which she is highly appreciated and sought after.

This is her second loan with Soro Yiriwaso and the previous loan has been repaid. It is within the context of expanding her activities that she decided to request a new loan from Soro Yiriwaso to buy 3 freezers.

She resupplies in Lomé, and resells the freezers in her shop to a mixed customer base.

She anticipates monthly profits of 100,000 FCFA, with which she plans to expand her business activity.

loans.use: Buy freezers

loans.name: Pima Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe   PIMA  est constitué de 6 femmes toutes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de36 ans et. 6 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles traditionnelles élargies avec leurs maris, coépouses, frères et fils dans le quartier Massablacoura de la ville de Bougouni. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles ont adhéré à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur neuvième prêt. Les huit précédents prêts ont été correctement remboursés. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de  céréales à travers MARIAM, elle est la première femme de la droite vers la gauche. Elle fait l’achat vente de céréales  et compte acheter avec son  prêt, 2 tonnes de maïs avec les producteurs. Elle effectue ses ventes au marché  et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle composée essentiellement de femmes. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 40.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
The Pima Group is made up of six married women with an average age of 36 years and an average of six children. They live in traditional extended families with their husbands, co-wives, brothers and sons in the Massablacoura district of the city of Bougouni. These women know one another through ties of vicinity, friendship and commerce. To strengthen their financial capacity with the aim of improving their business, the group joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are currently on their ninth loan cycle. The eight previous loans have been repaid in full.

This group of women does business selling grain through Mariam, shown in the photo on the far right. Mariam buys and sells grain, and with this loan, she plans to purchase two tons of corn from growers. Mariam sells her grain at the market and from her home, at retail, for cash and on credit to a clientele composed mainly of women. Mariam expects to earn an average monthly income of 40,000 FCFA, which she will use to reinvest in her business and repay the loan.

loans.use: to purchase grain.

loans.name: Sebe

texts.fr:
Madame Sébé  est âgée de 37 ans, marié et mère de un enfant. Elle réside avec son conjoint dans une famille polygame à Torakabougou, un des quartiers de la ville de Bougouni (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Après une formation en santé, Sébé s’est vite initiée aux activités d’achat de vente de produits pharmaceutiques depuis plus de sept  ans. Avec une telle expérience dans ce domaine, elle jouit d’une forte réputation. Après 1 prêt individuel qui a été correctement remboursé, elle est à son deuxième prêt qui sera utilisé pour acheter,  2 cartons de produits contre le paludisme, 1 carton produits contre les maladies respiratoires, 1 carton d’antibiotiques et 5 litres d’alcool. 
Sa source d’approvisionnement principale est à Bamako (capitale du Mali). Elle effectue ses ventes dans sa pharmacie à Bougouni à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes, en détail et au comptant et parfois en crédit à des personnes qui lui sont proches. 
Avec ce  nouveau prêt, elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 30.000 FCFA. Avec ce bénéfice réalisé, elle compte résoudre l’essentielle de ses dépenses, celles de sa famille, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Sébé is 37 years old, married and the mother of one child. She lives with her spouse in a polygamous family in Torakabougou, one of the districts of Bougouni town (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). After having completed a health training course, Sébé quickly got into buying and selling pharmaceutical products, which she has been doing for 7 years. She enjoys a good reputation, with so much experience in her line of work. 

After one individual loan, which has been properly repaid, she is on her second loan which will be used to buy 2 boxes of anti-malarial products, 1 box of medicine for respiratory diseases, 1 box of antibiotics and 5 litres of alcohol. Her main supply source is in Bamako, Mali's capital city. She makes her sales in her pharmacy in Bougouni to a retail clientèle made up of men and women, for cash or occasionally credit to those customers who are close to her. With the help of this new loan, she expects to make a monthly profit of 30 000 francs. She will use part of this profit to cover most of her expenses, including family expenditures and the loan interest, and she will reinvest the rest in her business.

loans.use: to buy medicine.

loans.name: Sabougnouma Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe SABOUGNOUMA  est constitué de 6 femmes toutes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 34 ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles traditionnelles élargies avec leurs maris, coépouses, frères et fils dans le quartier Massablacoura de la ville de Bougouni. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles ont adhéré à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur premier prêt. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de farine à travers BADJENE,elle  est la deuxième femme de la droite vers la gauche. Elle fait l’achat vente de farine et compte acheter avec son  prêt 300Kg  farine avec les commerçants de Bamako. Elle effectue ses ventes à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle composée essentiellement de femmes. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 17500FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
The Sabougnouma Group is made up of six married women with an average age of 34 years and an average of four children. They live in traditional extended families with their husbands, co-wives, brothers and sons in the Massablacoura district of the city of Bougouni. They know one another through ties of vicinity, friendship and commerce. To increase their financial capacity and improve their businesses, they joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are on their first loan cycle.

This group does business selling flour through Badjene, shown second from the right in the photo. Badjene buys and sells flour, and with this loan she plans to purchase 300 Kg of flour from the merchants in Bamako. She sells her flour from her home, at retail, for cash and on credit to a clientele composed mainly of women. Badjene expects to make an average monthly income of 17,500 FCFA, which she will use to reinvest in her business and repay her loan.

loans.use: to purchase flour.

loans.name: José Rubén

texts.es:
José Rubén es un joven de 32 años que habita en la comarca San Agustín del municipio de El Sauce ubicado a 15 km de dicho municipio, padre de dos niños en edad escolar.

Se desempeña como Guarda de seguridad en una Institución donde tiene siete años de laborar. Para él que habita en el campo le ha tocado una vida dura, ya que proviene de una familia muy pobre que sus únicos ingresos han sido la cosecha de granos para subsistir, pero le da gracias por tener trabajo actualmente donde hoy tiene ingresos fijos para llevar el pan de cada día a su hogar.

Diario tiene que recorrer estos 15 km de ida y regreso en bicicleta para estar puntual en su centro de trabajo y lo desempeña de la mejor manera y con entusiasmo porque en Nicaragua hay mucho desempleo y muchas personas que desean tener un trabajo digno.

Actualmente está solicitando un crédito para Compra de medicamentos, pago de consultas y realización de exámenes, ya que su hija ha estado mal de salud y con lo poco que gana no puede cubrir estos gastos.

Pide el apoyo y ayuda a los inversionistas de Kiva para que le financien este crédito a través de Ceprodel y poder curar a su niña.
texts.en:
José Rubén is a 32-year old young man who lives in the region of San Agustín, located 15km away from the municipality of El Sauce. He has two children attending school. 

He has worked as a security guard in an institution for 7 years. He used to have a tough life living in the countryside as he comes from a very poor family where the only income came from grain harvests. However, he's now grateful for having a job and fixed income to take the bread home. He needs to cover 15km by bicycle to go and return from work everyday and works very well and with enthusiasm. Nicaragua has a high unemployment and many people wish to have a decent job. 

He's now requesting a loan to buy medicines and pay doctor bills and medical tests, as his daughter has been ill and he can't afford to cover those expenses. He's asking for the help and support of Kiva lenders so that they will finance this loan through Ceprodel and help him heal his daughter.

loans.use: to buy medicines and pay doctor bills and medical tests.

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe  DANAYA  est constitué de 6 femmes toutes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de32 ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles traditionnelles élargies avec leurs maris, coépouses, frères et fils dans le quartier Massablacoura de la ville de Bougouni. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles ont adhéré à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur huitième prêt. Les précédents prêts ont été correctement remboursés. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce des ustensiles de cuisine à travers de MAIMOUNA. Elle est la troisième femme de la gauche vers la droite Elle fait l’achat vente des  ustensiles de cuisine et compte acheter avec son  prêt, 10 douzaines de tasses en plastique  à Bamako. Elle effectue ses ventes au marché  et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle composée essentiellement de femmes. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 40.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
The Danaya group is made up of 6 women who are all married and have an average age of 32 and, on average, 4 children. They all live in traditional, extended families with their husbands, co-spouses, brothers and sons in the district of Massablacoura, in Bougouni town. They got to know each other through neighbourly and professional relationships, and friendships. They joined the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution in order to strengthen their financial capacity, so that they could better do business. They are on their 8th loan and the previous loans have been correctly repaid.

This group of women sells kitchen utensils via Maimouna. She is the third from the left in the picture. She buys and sells kitchen utensils and plans to use her loan to buy 10 dozen plastic cups in Bamako. She makes her sales at the market and at home, for cash or credit, to a clientèle mostly made up of women. She expects to make an average monthly profit of 40 000 francs, part of which will be reinvested in her business and part of which will be used to repay the loan.

loans.use: to buy kitchen utensils.

loans.name: Mouhamadou Mamoune

texts.fr: Monsieur Mouhamadou Mamoune,marié et père de 2 enfants évolue dans le commerce depuis 2 ans.Il habite aux environs de l'IMCEC.Son activité consiste à acheter du charbon de bois et de l'huile de palme en Casamance.Il vient solliciter un crédit de 150000F CFA pour se procurer de la marchandise pour venir revendre dans le voisinage.Avec les bénéfices générés,il compte épargner une partie et satisfaire les besoins alimentaires de sa famille.
texts.en: Mouhamadou Mamoune is married and the father of 2 children. He has been a retailer for 2 years. He lives in the surrounding area of the UIMCEC branch. He buys charcoal and palm oil in the Casamance region and is requesting a loan of 150 000 francs with which to buy more merchandise for resale in his neighbourhood. He plans to use part of the profits he makes to satisfy his family's food needs, and to save the rest.

loans.use: to buy charcoal and palm oil for resale.

loans.name: Djiguisseme Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe  DJIGUISSEME  est constitué de 3 femmes  mariées et 1 veuve ayant une moyenne d’âge de 52 ans et.  5 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles traditionnelles élargies avec leurs maris, coépouses, frères et fils dans le quartier Massablacoura de la ville de Bougouni. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles ont adhéré à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur huitième prêt. Les sept précédents prêts ont été correctement remboursés. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de céréales à travers KADIATOU qui est la femme assise papier en main.  Elle fait l’achat vente de céréales et compte acheter avec son  prêt 1200Kg de maïs avec les paysans. Elle effectue ses ventes au marché  et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle composée essentiellement de femmes. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 50.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
The Djiguisseme group is constituted of three married women and one widow averaging 52 years of age, with five children. They live in traditional extended families with their husbands, other wives, brothers and children in the Massablacoura district of the town of Bougouni.

They know each other as neighbors and friends as well as through their work. IN order to strengthen their financing capacity and better manage their business, they have joined the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution and are now on their eight loan. The seven preceding loans have been duly repaid. The group members sell cereals, which is what Kadiatou does, for example. She is the one holding a paper in her hands. She buys and resells cereals, and her plan is to user her loan to buy 1200 kg [2646 lbs] of cereals from farmers. She sells at the market and out of her home, retail, for cash and on credit, to a customer base composed mainly of women. She plans to achieve an average monthly revenue of 50,000 West African francs, which will be reinvested in her business and used to pay off the loan.

loans.use: to buy cereals.

loans.name: Ali

texts.fr:
Monsieur Ali est un homme marié de 39 et père de 3 enfants. Il réside avec sa femme et ses enfants chez son père dans le quartier Dialanicoro de Bougouni.
N’ayant pas fréquenté l’école moderne, très vite il commença des activités génératrices de revenus.
Monsieur Ali fut pendant des années un commerçant des bétails. Il avait aussi tenté l’activité d’achat et la vente de pièces détachées sans réussite. C’est ainsi qu’il décide alors de suivre son ami pour apprendre la vente de céréales
Avec une expérience de plus de 6 années, il maîtrise son activité.
Pour agrandir son entreprise, il décida de prendre un prêt avec Soro Yiriwaso pour acheter 1/2 tonne de maïs  et 2  tonnes de riz de production locale.
Il s’approvisionne à Bougouni et dans les villages  environnants mais aussi dans le Wassoulou pour ensuite les revendre dans le marché de Bougouni et  une partie à Yanfolila sa clientèle mixte.
Il est à son quatrième prêt avec Soro Yiriwaso. Tous les prêts précédent ont été correctement remboursés
Avec ce prêt il envisage  réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 85 000 FCFA. Qui servira à subvenir à ses dépenses, payer les intérêts du prêt et à agrandir son entreprise..
texts.en:
Mr. Ali is a 39-years old married man and a father with three children. He resides with his wife and children at his father's house in the Dialanicoro district of Bougouni. Not having had formal schooling, he soon started revenue-generating businesses. 

For years, Mr. Ali was a livestock merchant. He had also tried buying and selling spare parts without success. This is why he decided to follow his friend in order to learn about selling grains. With over six years of experience, he is mastering this business. 

To expand his enterprise he decided to take out a Soro Yiriwaso loan to purchase a half-tonne of corn and 2 tonnes of rice produced locally. 

He gets his supplies in Bougouni and in surrounding villages, but also in Wassoulou, and then he resells the goods at the Bougouni market, and some in Yanfolila. His customer base is mixed. 

He is on his fourth loan with Soro Yiriwaso. All the previous loans were paid back correctly. With this loan, he envisions making a monthly profit of 85,000 francs CFA that will be used to cover his expenses, pay the loan interest, and expand his enterprise.

loans.use: to purchase grains

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy empty cans and bottles which he will resell to earn his living.

loans.name: Lolo Group

texts.fr:
LOLO est un groupe de l’association FAIDA de DONGORONA. Il regroupe 5 femmes qui se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage. Elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans. Mariées avec en moyenne quatre enfants, elles mènent différentes activités  telles l’achat vente de condiment et de la restaurant à l’image de DJENEBADIAN qui est la première personne  debout de la gauche vers la droite  de la photo. Elles vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles à DONGORONA dans la  préfecture de Kati (Région de Koulikoro, République du Mali). 
Elles sont dans le petit commerce depuis plusieurs années et sont très sollicitées dans leurs activités. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin croissant de leur clientèle, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso il y a un an. Elles sont à leur premier  prêt solidaire. 
DJENEBADIAN, qui est la présidente du groupe et très connue à DONGORONA, excelle dans la vente de plats alimentaires. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter de condiments alimentaires, oignon, choux,  du riz et poissons.  Elle s’approvisionne à Bamako et sur place auprès des grossistes  et vend ses mets  à DONGORONA, en détail, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.   
Elle espère sur un bénéfice mensuel de 10.000FCFA somme qui lui  permettra de rembourser le prêt et de réinvestir dans son activité.
texts.en:
LOLO is a group belonging to the Faida Association of Dongorona. It consists of five women who became acquainted through kinship and neighborhood ties. They are on average 40 years old, married with four children. They conduct various activities such as buying and selling condiments and preparing meals like Djenebadian who is the first person standing left to right in the photo.

They live in large traditional families in Dongorona in the prefecture of Kati (Region of Koulikoro, republic of Mali). They have been active in retail commerce for several years and are very sought after in their activities.

To satisfy the increasing demands of their customers, the group decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso credit loan program a year ago. They are on their first joint loan.

Djenebadian, who is the president of the group and very well known in Dongorona, excels in the sale of cooked food. She plans to use her loan to buy condiments, onions, cabbages, rice and fish. She stocks up in Bamako and with local wholesalers, and sells food in Dongorona at retail prices, for cash and credit to a clientele composed of men and women.

She hopes to obtain monthly profits of 10,000 FCFA that will enable her to repay the loan and reinvest in her business.

loans.use: Buy ingredients to prepare meals

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr: Madame Fatou mariée et mère de famille habite à quelques mètres de l'IMCEC.Elle évolue dans le commerce depuis plus de 10 ans,elle vend des variétés de tissus.Elle sollicite un pret de 200000F CFA pour acheter des tissus afin de générer plus de bénéfices pour pouvoir épargner,renforcer son activité et épauler son mari.
texts.en: Fatou is married and a mother. She lives a few metres from the UIMCEC branch. She has been a retailer for over 10 years and sells a variety of fabrics. She is requesting a loan of 200 000 francs with which to buy fabrics in order to generate more profits so that she can build her savings, strengthen her business and support her husband.

loans.use: to buy fabric for resale.

loans.name: Souleymane

texts.fr:
Monsieur Souleymane est un célibataire de 25 ans qui n’a pas d’enfant. Il vit chez son père à Bougouni dans le quartier Faraba.
Après ses études, Monsieur Souleymane est resté pendant des années sans emploi. Toutes ses dépenses étaient assurées par son père. Devant cette situation il décide de faire le commerce. Après avoir eu un petit à travers son père il se lance dans l’achat et la vente des téléphones portables et accessoires. Il a appris cette activité auprès de son ami. Avec une expérience de 5 ans, il maîtrise son activité.
Pour avoir un fonds de roulement consistant il décide de prendre un autre prêt avec Soro Yiriwaso qu’il a connu à travers son père pour acheter 18 téléphones portables de plusieurs marques et le reste de l’argent est réservé à l’achat des autres accessoires (façades, batteries et chargeurs). Il est son deuxième prêt avec Soro Yiriwaso, le précédent ayant été correctement remboursé. Il s’approvisionne à Bamako capitale de la république du Mali.
Avec ce prêt, il compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 50 000 FCFA. Il envisage d’agrandir son entreprise et aider son père à assurer les dépenses de la famille et à payer les intérêts du prêt.
texts.en:
Mr. Souleymane, age 25, is single without children. He lives in his father’s home in Bougouni, in the district of Faraba. After his studies, Souleymane remained unemployed for several years. All his expenses were covered by his father. He decided to attempt commercial activities. With a bit of help from his father, he started to buy and sell mobile phones and accessories, a business that he learned from a friend. With five years of experience, he now has a good command of his activity. 

To maintain a steady working capital, he is seeking a new loan with the Soro Yiriwaso MFI, to which he was introduced through his father. He will use the credit to buy 18 mobile phones of various brands, and a variety of accessories (skin cases, batteries, chargers). This is his second loan with Soro 
Yiriwaso. The first one was correctly repaid. 

Souleymane buys his stock in Bamako, the capital of the Republic of Mali. With this loan, he expects to earn a monthly profit of 50 000 FCFA. He plans to expand his business, to help his father with the household expenses, and to pay the loan interest.

loans.use: to buy mobile phones and accessories for resale.

loans.name: Sabali Group

texts.fr:
DIAMADJIGUI est un groupe de l’association SABALI de N’TENTOU. Il regroupe 4 femmes qui se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage. Elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 43 ans. Mariées avec en moyenne six enfants, elles mènent différentes activités  telles l’achat vente de condiments à l’image de SETOU qui est la première personne debout de la droite vers la gauche de la photo. Elles vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles à N’TENTOU dans la  préfecture de Kati (Région de Koulikoro, République du Mali). 
Elles sont dans le petit commerce depuis plusieurs années et sont très sollicitées dans leurs activités. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin croissant de leur clientèle, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso il y a deux ans. Elles sont à leur quatrième prêt solidaire. 
SETOU, qui est la présidente du groupe et très connue à N’TENTOU, excelle dans la vente de condiments. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter de condiments alimentaires : oignon, choux, gombo séché, des épices et des cubes Maggi.  Elle s’approvisionne à Bamako et sur place auprès des grossistes  et vend ses condiments à N’TENTOU et OUELESSEBOUGOU, en détail, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle espère sur un bénéfice mensuel de 20.000FCFA somme qui lui  permettra de rembourser le prêt et de réinvestir dans son activité.
texts.en:
Diamadjigui is a group that is a member of the Sabali de N'tentou association, and made up of four women who came to know each other through family and neighbourhood contacts. They are on average 43 years old, married, with six children. They have different activities such as the buying and selling of condiments like Setou who is the first person standing looking from right to left in the photo. They live in big traditional families in N'tentou in Kati prefecture (Koulikoro region, Mali republic)

They have been running small businesses for several years and are very much in demand for their activities.

In order to satisfy growing customer demand, they decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso credit programme two years ago. This is their fourth solidarity loan.

Setou, who is the president of the group and very well known in N'tentou, excels in the sales of condiments. She intends to use her loan to buy food condiments: onion, cabbage, dried okra, spices and Maggi cubes. She buys her stock in Bamako and locally from wholesalers and sells her goods retail in N'tentou and Ouelessebougou for cash or credit to both men and women customers. She hopes to make a monthly profit of 20.000FCFA which would enable her to repay her loan and reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To buy condiments.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Le  groupe Benkadi est  composé exclusivement de femmes mariées, ayant en moyenne 32 ans, 5 enfants et vivant toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Chakabougou, commune de Kaladougou, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce d’habillements et d’articles divers de boutique.                                                                                                                 
Les femmes du groupe Benkadi sont à leur deuxième prêt solidaire qui sera utilisé pour acheter des habillements et des articles de boutique.                                                                                                                                                                                                 
La cliente ASSAN, première personne à partir de la droite dans le rang des assises, compte acheter, 5 pièces de pagnes fancy  avec les grossistes de Dioïla pour ensuite revendre sur place à la maison en ambulante et au marché de Dioïla.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 10 000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour ses besoins de la famille et une partie est réinvestie dans l’activité de commerce d’habits.
texts.en:
The Benkadi group is composed exclusively of married women. They average 32 years of age, with five children, and all live in traditional extended families in the village of Chakabougou, Kaladougou community, Doio prefecture, Koulikoro Region (the second administrative region of Mali).

They know each other as relatives, neighbors and friends. They sell clothing and miscellaneous items.
The group members are on their second solidarity loan which will be used to buy clothing and miscellaneous items.
Assan, the first client seated on the right, plans to buy five sets of traditional “pagnes” fabric of the “fancy” grade from wholesalers in Diola, in order to resell them locally out of her house or as a street vendor and a the Diola market.
She plans to earn an average monthly revenue of 10,000 West African francs, which will be  spent for her family needs, and a part of it reinvested in her clothing business.

loans.use: to buy traditional "pagnes" fabric.

loans.name: Sekouba

texts.fr:
Né en avril 1980 à BAMAKO, SEKOUBA vit avec ses 5 enfants et son épouse dans une  famille monogame dans le quartier N'tentou de la ville de Ouelessebougou. 
Enseignant de profession,  très vite SEKOUBA s’est  intéressé aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment l’achat vente de d’habillements et de prêt-à-porter. Après avoir correctement remboursé le prêt précédent, SEKOUBA est à son deuxième  prêt avec Soro Yiriwaso qui sera utilisé pour acheter, trois balles de prêt-à-porter auprès des  grossistes. Elle effectue ses ventes au comptant, à crédit et en détail, à domicile, dans le marché Ouelessebougou à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
SEKOUBA espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 40.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour   subvenir aux besoins de la famille, rembourser le prêt et réinvestir dans les activités.
texts.en:
Born in April 1980 in Bamako, Sekouba lives with his five children and his wife in a monogamous family in the N'tentou neighborhood of the city of Ouelessebougou.

A teacher by profession, Sekouba quickly became interested in income-generating activities, including the purchase and sale of apparels and ready-to-wear clothing.

Having successfully repaid the previous loan, Sekouba is on his second loan with Soro Yiriwaso, which will be used to buy three bales of ready-to-wear clothing from wholesalers.

He sells retail for cash or credit, through home delivery and at the Ouelessebougou market, to a clientele composed of men and women.

Sekouba hopes to make monthly profits of 40,000 FCFA that will be used to support his family, reimburse the loan and reinvest in the business.

loans.use: Buy clothes

loans.name: Awa

texts.fr: Madame Awa agée de 33 ans,habite à 1km environ de l'IMCEC.Elle est mariée et mère d'un enfant.Elle évolue dans le commerce depuis plus de 2 ans.Avec ce commerce,elle épaule son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes et compte un jour avoir sa propre maison et mettre à l'aise son foyer.Elle sollicite un pret de 75000F CFA pour aller acheter de la marchandise du miel et de l'huile de palme...
texts.en: Awa, who is 33 years old, lives about 1 kilometre from the UIMCEC branch. She is married and the mother of one child. She has been a retailer for over 2 years. Thanks to her business, she supports her husband with the daily expenditures and plans one day to have her own house and create a comfortable environment for everyone in the household. She is requesting a loan of 75 000 francs so that she can go and buy merchandise; honey and palm oil.

loans.use: to buy honey and palm oil for resale.

loans.name: Benkoro Group

texts.fr:
BENKORO est un groupe de l’association FAIDA de DONGORONA. Il regroupe 6 femmes qui se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage. Elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 30 ans. Mariées avec en moyenne cinq enfants, elles mènent différentes activités  telles l’achat vente de condiment et de la restaurant à l’image de ROKIA qui est la troisième personne  debout de la gauche vers la droite de la photo. Elles vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles à DONGORONA dans la  préfecture de Kati (Région de Koulikoro, République du Mali). 
Elles sont dans le petit commerce depuis plusieurs années et sont très sollicitées dans leurs activités. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin croissant de leur clientèle, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso il y a un an. Elles sont à leur premier prêt solidaire. 
ROKIA, qui est la présidente du groupe et très connue à DONGORONA et compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter de condiments alimentaires, oignon, choux et viande pour sa restauration.  Elle s’approvisionne à Bamako et sur place auprès des grossistes  et vend ses aliments à DONGORONA, en détail, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.   
Elle espère sur un bénéfice mensuel de 20.000FCFA somme qui lui  permettra de rembourser le prêt et de réinvestir dans son activité.
texts.en:
The Benkoro group, is a member of the Faida de Dongorona association. It is composed of six women who became acquainted through family and neighbourhood contacts. They are of an average age of 30 and married with about five children each. They run various businesses such as condiment selling and catering like Rokia who is the third person standing, looking from left to right in the photo. They live in big traditional families in Dongorona in Kati prefecture (Koulikoro region, Mali republic)
They have been running their small businesses for several years and are very much in demand for their commerce.
In order to satisfy growing customer demand, the members of the group decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso micro credit institution a year ago. This is their first solidarity loan.
Rokia, who is the president of the group, is well known in Dongorona. She plans to use her loan to purchase food condiments, onion, cabbage and meat for her catering business. She buys her stock in Bamako and locally from wholesalers, and sells her preparations retail in Dongorona, for cash and for credit to a clientele of both men and women.
She hopes to make a monthly profit of 20.000FCFA which would enable her to pay back her loan and reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for catering.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy merchandise (beans, eggs, soap,...) to sell in her shop

loans.name: Benso Group

texts.fr:
BENSO est un groupe de l’association SARAMAYA de N’TENTOU. Il regroupe 4 femmes qui se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage. Elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 45 ans. Mariées avec en moyenne cinq enfants, elles mènent différentes activités  telles l’achat vente de condiments à l’image de AWA qui est la deuxième personne  assise de la droite vers la gauche de la photo. Elles vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles à N TENTOU dans la  préfecture de Kati (Région de Koulikoro, République du Mali). 
Elles sont dans le petit commerce depuis plusieurs années et sont très sollicitées dans leurs activités. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin croissant de leur clientèle, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso il y a deux ans. Elles sont à leur troisième prêt solidaire. 
AWA, qui est la présidente du groupe et très connue à N’TENTOU,  elle excelle dans la vente de condiments. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter de condiments alimentaires : oignon, choux, cube Maggi,  sel de cuisine et  concentrée de tomate.  Elle s’approvisionne à Bamako et sur place auprès des grossistes  et vend ses condiments à N’TENTOU et à OUELESSEBOUGOU, en détail, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.   
Elle espère sur un bénéfice mensuel de 15.000FCFA somme qui lui  permettra de rembourser le prêt et de réinvestir dans son activité.
texts.en:
Benso is a group of the Saramaya de N'tentou association. It is made up of four women who came to know each other through family and neighbourhood contacts. They are on average  45 years old. Married and with about five children each, they have various activities such as the buying and selling of condiments, like AWA who is the second person sitting down in the photo looking from right to left. They live in large traditional families in N'tentou in the Kati prefecture (Koulikoro region, Mali republic).
They have been running small businesses for several years and are very much in demand for their activities.
In order to satisfy the growing demands of their customers, the members of the group decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso programme two years ago. This is their third solidarity loan.
Awa, who is the president of the group, is very well known in N'tentou, she is an excellent condiment saleswoman. She plans to use her loan to buy alimentary condiments: onion, cabbage, Maggi cubes, cooking salt, and tomato concentrate. She buys her stock in Bamako and from local wholesalers and sells her goods in N'tentou and Ouelessebougou, retail, for cash or for credit to a clientele made up of men and women.
She hopes to make a monthly profit of 15.000FCFA which would enable her to repay her loan and reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To purchase food condiments.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: replenish her capital by buying traditional medicines for resale, to continue earning her living.

loans.name: Nahomie De Danda Group

texts.fr:
Nanotte est le coordinatrice de son groupe Nahomie de Danda. Elle est un commercante. ils habite dans la région de Danda où de l’électricité est rare et de l’eau est très limitée.

Nanotte a dirigé son commerce de produit alimentaire pendant 7 années. Avant de commencer ce commerce elle était un Etudiant. Elle voudrait utiliser cet emprunt pour investir dans les produit alimentaires et elle espère que cet emprunt l’aidera à agrandir son commerce.

Des autres membres militant ont besoin d’un emprunt pour tels commerces de produit divers comme charbon, cosmetiques, chaussures, vetement, etc. Nanotte dit que les défis principal c'est devenus une grande commerçante.
texts.en:
Nanotte is the coordinator of her Nahomie de Danda group. She is a trader and lives in the region of Danda where electricity is rare and water very limited. 

Nanotte has been managing her food business for seven years and before launching this business she was a student. She would like to use this loan to invest in food products and hopes it will help her to expand her business.

The other active members of the group need a loan for charcoal, cosmetics, shoes, clothing and other businesses. Nanotte says that her main challenge is to become a significant trader.

loans.use: to buy food products such as rice, meat, flour, etc.

loans.name: Neris Ramona

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Junín se reúne cada quince días en el cantón Junín, este lugar se lo conoce por su gente amable y trabajadora y porque se destila el mejor aguardiente en la provincia y en el Ecuador.

En este lugar vive la señora Neris, tiene 60 años de edad, hace varios años su querido esposo falleció y quedo viuda pero de esta relación tuvo 6 hijos los mismos que ya son  mayores de edad, la menor tiene 20 años y estudia en universidad.

Doña Neris para que a su familia no le falte nada  se dedica al comercio, vende productos naturales de la marca Garden y de ropa interior de todo tipo. Trabaja todos los días más que todo en las horas de la mañana ya que a esas horas le resulta más fácil realizar sus recorridos, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y bajo pedidos, ella deja a crédito y cobra semanalmente. Se dedica a este negocio desde hace 8 años y le ha ido muy bien ya que tiene bastante clientela y gracias a esto no le falta nada en su hogar. 

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar ropa interior y productos naturales ya que tiene varios pedidos. Lleva 9 años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque con uno de los créditos empezó su negocio que hoy le permite ganarse la vida. 

Su sueño es que su hija termine sus estudios.
texts.en:
The "Junín" communal bank meets every fortnight in the Junín district.  This is a place known for its friendly and hard-working people and for having the best liquor in the province, and, indeed, in Ecuador.

It is here that 60-year-old Neris lives.  A few years ago her dear husband died and she became a widow.  However, she does have six children from this relationship, all of whom are now adults.  The youngest is twenty and is studying at university.

Neris has a business so that her family is not in need of anything.  Neris sells natural products from the "Garden" brand and all types of underwear.  She works every day, mainly in the morning as it is easier to do her runs then.  She sells door-to-door and people leave orders with her.  Customers pay in installments, which Neris collects on a weekly basis.  She has had this business for eight years now and it is going well for her as she has a good customer base.  Thanks to this work, Neris doesn't want for anything.

Neris will use this loan to buy underwear and natural products, as she already has various orders.  She has been with the communal bank for nine years and she likes it because it was with one of the loans that she started this business that allows her to earn a living.

Her dream is for her daughter to finish her studies.

loans.use: to buy underwear and natural products.

loans.name: Oneyda Patricia

texts.es:
La señora Oneyda se dedica al comercio su actividad principal es la venta de golosinas (nacatamales) venta de ropa interior y cerdos, desde hace 3 años.
Doña Oneyda es una mujer muy trabajadora y emprendedora de la comunidad donde vive, tiene su negocio propio por la falta de trabajo que existe en esa zona. Empezó vendiendo nacatamales de manera ambulante y por la gran aceptación de los clientes, logro comprar un cerdito y revenderlo a mejor precio y de esta manera a logrado tener una casa propia darle el estudio a sus hijos y salir adelante con su familia.
Doña Oneyda está solicitando el préstamo para la compra de concentrado para los cerdos, hojas, harina, manteca, sal y para la compra de cremas, glases, listic, sombras, polvos, blusas, camisas que es su segundo negocio.
Doña Oneyda sueña con tener en el futuro una porqueriza y poder vender cerdos para destazo.



Danlí, Honduras -  Febrero 2013
texts.en:
Oneyda makes a living from her business. Her main work is selling sweets (including nacatamales, a corn food sold in a banana leaf), clothes and pigs.  She has been doing this for three years and is a very hard-working and enterprising woman in her community.  She started her own business because there was no work in the area.  She started as a street vendor, selling "nacatamales" and, with an excellent response from her customers, she was able to buy a pig that she could resell at a better price.  Through all this she has managed to buy her own home, pay for her children's education and help the family to prosper.

Oneyda is applying for this loan to buy feed, leaves, flour, butter and salt for the pigs and to buy creams, eye-shadow, powders, blouses, shirts and more for her second business.

Oneyda dreams of having her own swineherd and being able to sell the pigs for slaughter.

Danlí, Honduras, February 2013

loans.use: to buy feed, leaves, corn flour, butter, salt, creams, eye-shadow, powders, blouses, shirts and more for her business.

loans.name: Centro Santa Ana Group

texts.es:
La señora Angelica Patricia esta soltera, tiene 23 años de edad, curso los 6 años de educacion secundaria, se dedica a la compra y venta de manteca de cerdo, inició este negocio por la enseñanza de sus padres y hasta la fecha lleva 5 años de experiencia; también cuenta con el apoyo de su familia.

Organiza un grupo para solicitar un préstamo que lo utilizará para la compra de manteca para poder atender la demanda de sus cliente, en el futuro quiere tener un local grande en el mercado de su comunidad; las demás integrantes del grupo se dedican al comercio y a la crianza de animales.

Una de las integrantes del grupo no aparece en la foto porque no le fue posible estar presente en la reunion cuando tomaron la foto.
texts.en:
Angelica Patricia is single.  She is 23 years old and completed six years of high school.  She makes a living buying and selling lard, having learned the business from her parents.  She now has five years experience in this business and receives support from her family.

She is organising a group to apply for a loan that will be used to buy lard so that Angelica can meet the her customers's demand.  In the future she would like to have a big stall at the local market.  The other group members have businesses and raise animals.

One of the group members does not appear in the photo as she could not come to the meeting when the photo was taken.

loans.use: to buy lard.

loans.name: Oui Group

texts.fr:
Delphine  fait partie du groupe Oui  et est une des victimes de  l’incendie du marché central de Bujumbura. Elle est cliente de Turame. Elle  habite à  Bujumbura. Elle est mariée à Gabriel. 
Elle a sous sa charge 6 élèves, orphelins.

Elle faisait le commerce  des pagnes  au marché central de Bujumbura. Elle a perdu des marchandises d’une valeur de  450 $ par l’incendie.

Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  reconstituer son capital en achetant des pagnes, à revendre pour  continuer de gagner sa vie.
texts.en:
Delphine belongs to the Oui group and is one of the victims of the fire in Bujumbura's central market. She is a customer of Turame and lives in Bujumbura. She is married to Gabriel. She has six pupils in her care, who are orphans. 

She sold "pagnes" (brightly coloured pieces of fabric) at Bujumbura's central market and has lost $450 worth of goods in the fire.

With the loan that she is getting from KIVA she will be able to rebuild her capital by buying more "pagnes" which she will resell to continue making her living.

loans.use: to rebuild her capital by buying "pagnes" that she can resell to continue making a living.

loans.name: Upendo Group

texts.fr:
Rehema  fait partie du groupe Upendo  et   habite à Gitega. C’est une veuve  de  34 ans .Elle a 4 enfants âgés de  8  à 18 ans, tous étudient.

Elle fait le commerce de poissons (ndagala)  depuis 2 ans. 

Elle  est à son cinquième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  une grande quantité de poissons ndagala  à revendre, pour gagner plus.
texts.en:
Rehema belongs to the Upendo group and lives in Gitega. She is a 34-year old widow and has four children ranging from eight to 18 years of age, all of whom are studying.

She has been selling ndagala (small fish used frequently in Burundian cuisine) for the past two years and is on her fifth loan from Turame. With the loan she gets from KIVA she is going to increase her capital and buy a large quantity of ndagala to resell and thereby make more money.

loans.use: to boost her capital by buying a large quantity of ndagala (fish) to resell and make more money.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
La señora María es una persona trabajadora y muy responsable su actividad principal es un molino de maíz, ubicado en su casa de habitación desde hace 10 años, inicio con su negocio ya que en las comunidades donde vive en los años anteriores no tenían energía eléctrica y tenían que moler con un molino de mano. 
Doña María ahora que tienen luz en su comunidad, decidió iniciar con esta actividad misma que ha sido de mucha bendición para las personas, está solicitando el apoyo del préstamo para la compra de platos de molino, cemento, ladrillos, clavos para realizarle unas mejoras al local y comprar unos banquitos para que sus clientes puedan esperar cómodamente, mientras se les atiende.
Doña María sueña con tener un buen local tenerlo bien acondicionado y expandirse a otras comunidades que no existe molino de maíz.  


Danlí, Honduras - Febrero 2013
texts.en:
María is a hard-working and very responsible person.  Her main work is grinding corn which she has done in her home for ten years.  María started the business because there was no electricity in her community beforehand and you had to grind corn by hand.

María now has electricity in her town and so decided to start this work, which has been of great benefit to people.  She is applying for a loan to buy grinding plates, cement, bricks and nails so that she can make some improvements to her premises and to buy some benches so that customers can wait comfortably while she tends to them.

María dreams of having better-suited premises and expanding her business to other communities where there is no corn grinder.

Danlí, Honduras, February 2013

loans.use: to buy grinding plates, benches, cement, bricks and nails for her business.

loans.name: Campo Verde Group

texts.es:
El señor Jose de estado civil Unido de Hecho, tiene 45 años de edad, curso 4 años de educacion primaria, tiene 8 hijos y 3 de ellos estan estudiando, él se dedica a la agricultura, especificamente a la siembra y cosecha de arveja, tomate y ejote, inició este negocio con sus padres y hasta la fecha tiene ya 20 años de experiencia. cuenta con el apoyo de su esposa quien lo ayuda en la agricultura.

Organiza un grupo para poder solicitar un préstamo que lo utilizará para la compra de insumos para agricultura como abono, semillas, plaguicidas, etc. En el futuro quiere contar con su propio capital y ver su negocio grande; los demás integrantes del grupo tambien se dedican a la siembra de tomate, ejote y arbeja.

En al fotografía aparece una señora, pero, no se le doncedio el prestamo porque no llenó los requisitos.
texts.en:
Jose is in a common law marriage. He is 45 years old and went to 4 years of primary school. He has 8 children. Three of them are in school and he is a farmer. Specifically, he grows peas, tomatoes, and sweet corn. He started this business with his parents and so far has 20 years experience. He has his wife's support and she helps him with the farming. 

He organized a group to be able to ask for a loan, which he will use to buy agricultural materials such as fertilizer, seeds, pesticides, etc.In the future, he wants to have his own capital and see his business grow. The other members of the group also grow tomatoes, sweet corn and peas.

In the photograph there is a woman, She did not receive a loan because she didn't fill the requirements. .

loans.use: to buy agricultural materials.

loans.name: Bardhe

texts.en:
Bardhe is requesting a loan of 250,000 Albanian Lek to buy land for planting. This will be her second loan from the institution with the previous one paid on time and in full.

Bardhe is sixty years old and a married mother of three grown children. They live in a rural village of northern Albania. In the past twelve years, she has been selling milk and baby calves to the local market of a nearby main city.

“From morning till night this activity keeps me busy; milking, cleaning up the stable, feeding and preparing/storing food for my animals, going to the market and by the time I get home in the evening, I feel exhausted. Even though it is the same routine every day, and I get bored and overtired at times, I keep doing it because I have no other choice. I need an income and this keeps me going,” Bardhe said.

loans.use: To buy land for planting

loans.name: Roxana

texts.es: Roxana es una joven emprendedora, tiene mucha experiencia en la producción de leche y productos lácteos. necesita de un préstamo de un millón de colones (1.000.000) para comprar dos vacas lecheras más y así aumentar la producción de leche. Ella sabe que contar con mas vacas es un mayor sacrificio y demandará más trabajo pero esta muy feliz por la oportunidad. Con esto mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en: Roxana is a young entrepreneur. She has a lot of experience in milk and dairy product production. She needs a loan of a million colones (1,000,000) to buy two more dairy cows and thus increase milk production. She knows having more cows will be a bigger sacrifice and will demand more work but she is happy for the opportunity. With this, she will improve her and her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to produce milk.

loans.name: Mrike

texts.en:
Mrika is fifty four years old and lives in northern Albania. She is best known for her homemade delicious cow cheese. 

She started a livestock business about ten years ago and the business has been going very well according to her. “I love animals and I take great care of them. I have goats, sheep, cows and pigs. We live in the mountains and there is nothing else we can do, other than livestock. I make and sell cheese/cottage cheese and salty butter and also sell piglets, baby calves and lambs. This activity can generate a good income depending on how much you want to expand,” Mrika said. 

Mrika wants to buy two dairy cows with this loan.

loans.use: To add two more cows to the existing herd

loans.name: Dave

texts.en:
“The VisionFund loans have been a Godsend so I could provide for my family” was Dave’s bold statement.

Dave needs some financial help to expand her existing animal stable and she wants to thank all Kiva lenders in advance. The loan she is requesting is 80,000 Albanian Lek and it will be her sixth loan from VisionFund Albania. All of her loans have been paid on time and Dave has built a great relationship with the loan officers who assist her.

Dave is married and fifty-five years old with a twenty-three-year old son who lives with her in rural north Albania, in a little secluded village.

loans.use: To expand the existing animal stable

loans.name: Majlinda

texts.en:
Majlinda is a seamstress who has been in this industry for almost ten years. She wants to buy fabric and other materials she needs, and a loan of 150,000 Albanian Lek will help her achieve the goal; this will be her first loan. She has been the only financial provider for her family ever since she started her business.

She lives in a little town in central Albania with her husband and two children in their early twenties.
 
Majlinda has been experiencing a steady growth in business throughout the years. “It was a bit scary in the beginning because I didn’t know what to expect. There were other seamstresses in the town and this worried me, yet soon after I added extra services to clients such as sewing drapes,” said Majlinda “this gave a boost to my business,” she added.

loans.use: To stock up on her fabric material inventory

loans.name: San  Roque Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “SAN ROQUE”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.                                                                                                                                                                                             

La socia es la Sra. Leandra Matilde ella es viuda y tiene 54 años y tiene 3 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta y producción de leche y yogurt, la socia produce y luego lo vende en las diferentes tiendas, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 4:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 7 años en este negocio y el va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de leche y yogurt. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar leche y yogurt para su negocio.
El socio que esta pegado a la foto grupal se le tomo despues la foto porque pidio permiso por motivos de trabajo.
 Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de gaseosas, negocio de venta de comida, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de restaurant.

 
La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These members belong to the “SAN ROQUE” communal bank. This bank is located in the Cuzco district, in the province and department of Cuzco.                                                                                                                                                                                             

This member's name is Leandra Matilde. She is a 54 year old widow and has 3 children. She works at her business producing and selling milk and yogurt.   She produces and then sells in different stores. She works from 8:00 a.m. until 4:00 p.m. She has had this business for 7 years and it is going very well for her. Her dream is to expand the milk and yogurt selling business.  

The member who is in the photo next to the group photo had his picture taken later because he had to miss due to work. The other members work in businesses selling gasoline, selling food, running a grocery store, and a restaurant. 
 
This member is grateful to those who are a part of her dream in this way and she is committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy milk and yogurt for her business.

loans.name: Marjana

texts.en:
Marjana is requesting a loan to buy potato and onion seeds for planting. She has already started to prepare the soil.

Marjana is a 42-year-old married mother of three children; 22, 15 and 9 years old who each attend school. They live in southern Albania and Marjana’s main activity for the past five years has been in the agriculture sector. 

Their region is famous in Albania for producing the best potatoes, onions and dried beans. Almost every household’s focus is on this seasonal agricultural activity, since it has proved to be profitable. These products are bought by wholesalers and then exported to nearby countries.

loans.use: To buy potato and onion seeds for planting

loans.name: Tuidibek

texts.ru: Туйдибеку 45 лет. Он женат и отец четверых детей. Он со своей семьей живет в районе А.Джоми. У Туйдибек среднее техническое образование. Он работал телефонным мастером в течение 25 лет. Последние 5 лет Туйдибек занимается животноводством. Он покупает коров и телят, откармливает их несколько месяцев и затем продает их с наценкой на скотном рынке. Чтобы расширить свой бизнес и получить хорошую прибыль, Туйдибек просит кредит для купли и продажи крупнорогатого скота. За счет прибыли он хочет устроить свадьбу детей.
texts.en: Tuidibek is 45 years old, married, and is the father of 4 children. He and his family live in the A. Jomi region. He was educated in a technical high school, and for 25 years, he worked as a telephone repairman. For the past 5 years, he has been raising cattle. He purchases cows and calves, fattens them for several months, then sells them for a profit at the cattle market. In order to expand his business and earn a good income, Tuidibek is seeking a loan to help him buy and sell cattle. He plans to put the revenue generated by this loan toward his children's weddings.

loans.use: to buy and sell cattle

loans.name: Gaigin

texts.ru: Гайгину 68 лет. У него жена и пятеро детей. Он со своей семьей живет в районе А.Джоми. У Гайгин среднее техническое образование и он работает инструктором в автошколе. Одновременно Гайгин занимается животноводством - куплей и продажей крупнорогатого скота. Он занят в этой сфере более 37 лет и является опытным скотоводом. Сейчас Гайгин запрашивает кредит для купли и продажи крупнорогатого скота. За счет прибыли он хочет сделать ремонт в доме и улучшить условия проживания.
texts.en: Gaigin is 68 years old, married, and has 5 children. He and his family live in the A. Jomi region. He was educated in a vocational high school, and he works as an instructor in a driving school. At the same time, he is involved in animal husbandry, namely, in buying and selling cattle. He has been working in this field for more than 37 years and is an experienced stockman. He is now seeking a loan to help him buy and sell cattle. He wants to use the income generated by this loan to carry out home repairs and improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to buy and sell cattle

loans.name: Shohsanam

texts.ru: Шохсанам вдова с одним ребенком. Ей 29 лет. Она со своим ребенком живет в доме у родителей в Кубадияне в южной части Таджикистана. Шохсанам занимается растениеводством более 5 лет. Она арендует земельный участок, где выращивает бахчевые культуры. Так как сейчас сезон посева, Шохсанам обратилась за кредитом. Она просит кредит для приобретения семян арбуза, минеральных удобрений, топлива и оплаты тракториста. За счет прибыли с урожая Шохсанам планирует сделать ремонт в доме и улучшить условия проживания.
texts.en: Shohsanam is a 29-year-old widow with 1 child. She and her child live in her parents' home in Qubadiyon, which is located in the southern part of Tajikistan. For the last 5 years, Shohsanam has been growing crops. She rents a plot of land where she grows various types of melons. As it is now planting season, she is seeking a loan to purchase watermelon seeds, mineral fertilizers, and fuel, as well as to pay for the services of a tractor driver. She plans to use the income generated by this loan to carry out home repairs and to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase watermelon seeds, mineral fertilizer, and fuel, and to pay for the services of a tractor driver

loans.name: Khom

texts.en:
Khom is 59 years old. She is married and resides with her four children in the province of Kampong Chhnang in Cambodia. She has been selling grocery goods for more than three years, earning approximately $3 a day. Her husband is a rice farmer who makes an income of $1 a day. Her children are employed and earn about $18 per day. 

In order to improve her family’s finances, Khom requests a loan of $700 to purchase cosmetics so her daughter can run a beauty parlor. This loan will enable her daughter to generate additional income for the family. In the future, she would like to expand her grocery store and build a fence around her house.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics so her daughter can run a beauty parlor.

loans.name: Nim

texts.en:
Nim is 32 years old. He is married and resides with his wife in the province of Kampong Chhnang in Cambodia. He is a security guard who makes an income of $8 a day. His wife is a garment worker who earns about $5 each day. 

Due to the difficulty in the family’s transportation, Nim requests a loan of $1,200 to purchase a motorbike for commuting. This purchase will help him reduce his transportation expenses. In the future, he would like to generate more income for his family.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for commuting.

loans.name: Phavy

texts.en:
Phavy is 61 years old. She is a widow and resides with her two children in the province of Kampong Chhnang in Cambodia. She is a teacher for a primary school, earning an income of $4 a day. One of her children is a bus driver who earns about $16 per day. 

In order to improve her family’s security, Phavy requests a loan of $1,200 to purchase construction materials to build a fence. In the future, she would like to build a new house and help her youngest child earn a bachelor’s degree.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to build a fence.

loans.name: Chamroeun

texts.en: Chamroeun is 33 years old. She is married and resides with her husband and child in the province of Kampong Speu in Cambodia. She has been selling vegetables for more than five years, earning approximately $8 daily. Her husband is a motor taxi driver who makes an income of $5 per day. Because his present motorbike is old, Chamroeun is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase a new motorbike so her husband can run the taxi service. This purchase will help him attract more customers and earn more income for the family. In the future, she would like to expand their business and build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike so her husband can run his taxi service.

loans.name: Chan Khon

texts.en:
Chan Khon is 38 years old. She is married and resides with her husband and three children in the province of Kampong Speu in Cambodia. She is a housekeeper. Her husband is a construction foreman who makes an income of $10 daily. 

In order to improve her family’s finances, Chan Khon is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase more construction tools for her husband to use in his work. This purchase will enable him to bid for bigger construction projects. In the future, she would like to expand their business and send her children to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase more construction tools for her husband to use in his work.

loans.name: Gazmend

texts.en:
Gazmend is requesting a loan for the first time to purchase supplies and tools for his welding business.

Gazmend is a 28-year-old single man who currently lives in the northern Albania. For long time, he lived in the neighboring countries as an immigrant, where he learned the skills of welding and worked in the field. He is back now in his homeland and has started a welding business. The money he had saved was enough to build the shop and buy supplies and some tools to start off.
 
His activity is growing and for this he wants more supplies and some extra tools to do the job. “This loan will help me tremendously. Very soon I will hire someone to help me out, as I see that it’s too much for one person. I can’t serve all clients by myself,” Gazmend said.

loans.use: To buy tools and supplies for his welding business.

loans.name: Bardhe

texts.en:
Bardhe is 45 years old and lives in the northern Albania with her seven children and husband. Five of her children are still attending school.

Bardhe has been in the animal husbandry business for the past six years. She has been selling dairy products and also baby animals, including calves and piglets, in the local market of a little nearby town. The money she generates through this activity is the only source of income for the family. “I get help from my husband because going alone in this type of activity is tiresome," said Bardhe.  

She is requesting a loan now to plant fodder to feed her animals. The amount she is looking for is 100,000 Albanian Lek.

loans.use: to plant fodder to feed her animals.

loans.name: Gurazi

texts.en:
Gurazi, who lives in the southern Albania, is 58, married, and has a 24-year-old son. 

Gurazi has been in the agriculture/livestock type of activity for long time. He plants and sells crops, grains and vegetables in addition to fruits and dairy products.

“Agriculture and livestock are seasonal activities and the earning from them is seasonal as well. Yet, the work is not seasonal because you’ve got to work non-stopping,” he said, smiling.

He has submitted his application to VisionFund Albania for a loan of 200,000 Albanian Lek to purchase a dairy cow. Now that he is being told about the possibilities of borrowing from Kiva lenders, he is thrilled and wants to thank lenders in advance.

loans.use: To add one more dairy cow to the existing herd.

loans.name: Tonin

texts.en:
A loan of 110,000 ALL will help Tonin expand his animal stable. This will be his first loan from VisionFund Albania.

Tonin is a 49-year-old married villager who lives in northern Albania with his wife, their three school-aged children and his mother and deaf father. For the past fourteen years, Tonin has been operating his livestock/agriculture business and the earnings he has been generating through this activity have been good according to him.
