Blanca is a very hardworking woman who earns her living in a few different ways. For the last two years, one of these has been selling cosmetics. She also works cleaning houses, which she only does half-day. In her home, she also earns money by raising guinea pigs.

She will invest her new loan in the purchase of chickens, since she wants to increase her livestock. Her goals are to grow in each of her businesses and to have her own house.

loans.use: to purchase chickens.

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es:
El Señor Jorge vive en Guayaquil, el tiene 39 años de edad. Ya que el negocio es de familia, viene de generación en generación, y él desde muy joven a vendido cocada y jugos.

El realiza su trabajo solo no recibe ayuda de ninguna otra persona, ahora se dedica a la venta de cocada, la dificultad que se le atraviesa en su trabajo es su enfermedad, la cual no le permite realizar su trabajo con normalidad. El es soltero, y tiene 3 hijos, de la cual solo uno estudia en la escuela. 

El con el préstamo comprara materiales como: coco, azúcar, panela, para  la preparación de la cocada.
El sueño del cliente para el futuro es arreglar su casa y para su familia es poner a estudiar a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Sr. Jorge lives in Guayaquil. He is 39 years old and manages the family business that has been in operation generation after generation. From a young age, he has been selling coconut sweets and juices.

Jorge works alone and receives help from no one else. He currently sells coconut sweets and faces difficulty in his work due to illness, which prevents him from functioning normally. Jorge is single and has three children, but only one is attending school.

With this loan, he will buy supplies such as coconuts, sugar, and brown sugar for making coconut sweets. His dream for the future is to repair his house so that his children will have a place to study.

loans.use: to buy coconuts, sugar, and brown sugar.

loans.name: Kalsoom

texts.en:
Mrs. Kalsoom is a 37-year-old, married woman; she has been running a business of trading in animals for many years. With the help of her husband, she is running a successful business to provide for their family a decent life. She buys animals (baby goats & baby cows) at low prices, brings them up, and then her husband sells them out in the market at higher prices.

She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation. Now, she has requested a loan of Rs. 35,000. She will use it to purchase two more goats. She is in her fourth loan cycle, with a good repayment history. She hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving a good and quality education to her children, through all her hard work in her business.

loans.use: to purchase two more goats.

loans.name: Anwari

texts.en:
Anwari is a married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store, with her son, at the corner of her house. The boy shown in the photo is Anwari’s son. 

Anwari has gained five years of experience in this field. Her husband also assists her by purchasing stocks of goods from the market as he has maintained many contacts over the years.

Anwari is a mother of three children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing, and health. She wants to grow her business, so she requested a loan of PKR 40,000 to buy packs of salt, biscuits, and beverages to meet the increasing demands at her store. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of salt, biscuits, and beverages to meet the increasing demands at her store.

loans.name: Yarha Group

texts.es: Grupo formado por tres socias emprendedoras de éxito una de ella es Rosa mujer de 46 años de edad, acompañada, con 6 hijos mayores de edad, desde hace 10 años es comerciante  y su negocio es vender carteras, bolsos, mochilas, ropa nueva, chinelas etc. De ser cliente de la institución tiene 5 años. El crédito  lo invertirá en la compra de mercaderías como chinelas, carteras, bolsos, mochilas, zapatos etc. Karla tiene 38 años de edad y su negocio es una pulpería en su domicilio y María tiene 42 años de edad vende comida todos los días.
texts.en:
This group consists of three successful entrepreneurs. One of them is Rosa, a 46-year-old woman who is married and has six grown children. She has been a merchant for 10 years and her business consists of selling purses, bags, backpacks, new clothes, slippers, and other items. Rosa has been a client of ADIM for five years. Her loan will be invested in merchandise such as slippers, purses, bags, backpacks, shoes, and other items.

Karla is 38 years old and manages a store in her home. María is 42 years old and sells food every day.

loans.use: to buy slippers, purses, bags, backpacks, shoes, and other items.

loans.name: Gregoria Beladirna

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Junín se reúne cada quince días en el cantón Junín, este lugar se lo conoce por su gente amable y trabajadora y porque se destila el mejor aguardiente en la provincia y en el Ecuador.

En este lugar vive la señora Gregoria, tiene 46 años de edad, es madre soltera de una niña de 7  años de edad la misma que estudian en escuela. Ella vive en casa de sus padres. Lleva 4 años  en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan para salir adelante ella y su pequeña.

Doña Gregoria es una mujer muy luchadora que día a día trabaja honradamente para que a sus pequeña nunca le falte nada, ella tiene un pequeño local en la casa de los padres en la cual vende bebidas como aguas, sodas, energizantes y helados que ella misma prepara los cuales son deliciosos y del agrado de sus clientes que a diario acuden a su establecimiento, ella trabaja todos los días pero hay días muy buenos en los cuales le queda muchas ganancias sobre todo los fines de semana ya que llegan muchas personas a la ciudad por las ferias.

Este crédito es para comprar aguas, sodas, frutas, azúcar y leche para preparar los helados.
 
Su sueño es darle los mejor a su pequeña.
texts.en:
The Junín Communal Bank meets every 15 days in the canton of Junín. This place is known for its friendly people. The best brandy in the province and all of Ecuador is distilled here.

Sra. Gregoria lives in this place. She is 46 years old and a single mother with a seven-year-old daughter who is in school. Gregoria lives at the home of her parents. She has been with the Communal Bank for four years and enjoys the assistance she has received so that she and her young daughter can move forward.

Doña Gregoria is a determined woman who works honorably day after day so that her daughter will lack nothing. She has a small shop in her parents’ house where she sells beverages such as water, sodas, and energy drinks. Gregoria also sells delicious ice cream that she prepares herself. Her customers like it so much that they come to her establishment on a daily basis. She works every day, but the weekends are much better because there are many people who come to the city for the fairs.

This loan will be used to buy water and sodas, as well as fruit, sugar, and milk for making ice cream. Her dream is to provide the best for her young daughter.

loans.use: to buy water, sodas, fruit, sugar, and milk.

loans.name: Nozigul

texts.ru: Нозигул замужем. У нее два сына и одна дочь. Она со своей семьей проживает в городе Вахдат в юго-западной части Таджикистана. Муж Нозигул в данное время находится на заработках за пределами страны. Сама Нозигул работает в сфере торговли более 10 лет. На рынке города у нее имеется магазин, где она продает хозяйственные товары. Нозигул закупает свой товар с рынка города Душанбе в месяц четыре раза. Нозигул целеустремленный человек. Она хочет увеличить товарооборот и получить хорошую прибыль. С этой целью она обратилась за кредитом. Нозигул запрашивает кредит для приобретения парфюмерных изделий и одежд в свой магазин.
texts.en: Nozigul is married and has two sons and one daughter. She lives with her familes in Vahdat in southwestern Tadzhikistan. Nozigul's husband is currently working abroad. Nozigul herself has been working in retail for more than ten years. She has a shop at the city market where she sells housewares. Nozigul buys her products from a market in Dushanbe once a week. She is a very strong-willed person. She wants to increase her sales turnover and earn a good profit. It is with this goal in mind that she has applied for credit. Nozigul is seeking a loan to purchase perfumes and clothing for her shop.

loans.use: to purchase perfumes and clothing for her shop.

loans.name: Fozia

texts.en:
Mrs Fozia is a 37-year-old lady who enjoys doing the work of hand embroidery; she started doing this work with her daughters. Her embroidery patterns are very popular in her territory. Due to increasing demand for her embroidery designs, she is fostering other women in her business. Her husband is not in a good physical shape to support her family, so she is motivated to provide her family with the basic necessities of life, including food, clothes and education.

In order to satisfy the orders of her customers on time, she needs to engage some more women. For this reason, she requested a loan of Rs. 25,000 from Kashf Foundation. In this way, she can manage to buy more frames, needles, and thread of different colors, which will help in generating more income. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan.

loans.use: to buy more frames, needles, and thread of different colors, which will help in generating more income.

loans.name: Doris Azucena

texts.es:
La señora Doris es una muy buena persona emprendedora, responsable y trabajadora vive con  sus hijos en una comunidad al sur de Honduras. Su negocio es  venta  de maní.
Doña Doris el préstamo lo necesita para la compra  de maní.  Con el crédito espera  el aumento de las ventas debido a que contara con más producto  que ofrecer a los clientes. 
Doña Doris  espera cubrir sus necesidades, así mismo desea que su situación y la de su familia mejoren con esta inversión.
Doña Doris espera  que en 1 año  su negocio este posicionado como  el negocio  más grande y  conocido de su caserío  y poder seguir apoyando a  sus hijos  a que se conviertan en personas de bien.



Choluteca, Honduras – Febrero  del   2013
texts.en:
Sra. Doris is an outstanding individual who is enterprising, responsible, and hardworking. She lives with her children in a community in southern Honduras. Her business involves selling peanuts.

Doña Doris needs a loan so that she can buy peanuts. With this loan, she hopes to increase her sales by having more inventory to offer to her customers. She also wants to fulfill their needs. At the same time, she hopes that this investment will improve her family situation.

Within a year, Doña Doris expects to have a larger business that is well-known in her neighborhood. She wants to continue supporting her children so that they will become good people.

Choluteca, Honduras – February 2013

loans.use: to buy peanuts to sell.

loans.name: Kalsoom

texts.en:
Mrs Kalsoom is a 39-year-old, married woman. She has been running a business of selling dairy products, with her husband, for five years. She has two buffaloes in milk, and she sells milk to many of her neighbors, along with butter and cheese that she makes from the milk.  She looks after the buffaloes and performs the task of collecting milk from them, while her husband sells milk and dairy products to different places, on a daily basis. They are happily doing the business together, to support their family.

She needs to earn more to meet their everyday expenses, including food, clothing and education. She has been in association with Kashf Foundation for three years. Now she has requested a loan of Rs. 27,000, which she will use to buy one more buffalo, to increase her sales. Kalsoom hopes to get an increase in the production capacity of milk, which ultimately will help her to generate more cash.

loans.use: to buy one more buffalo, for dairy use.

loans.name: Saveta

texts.en:
Saveta has been operating a variety store for the last ten years, out of her own home. She has applied for a loan for the first time to stock up on inventory items for her store.

Saveta is in her fifties and has three school-aged children. They all live in a rural village in the part orf central Albania that is known for having a cultural monument since 1948. 

Saveta was the only one in the family to bring an income home until some years back when they started their little livestock business. They purchased the first animal with the savings from the store operations. Saveta expressed that selling milk, in addition to operating the variety store, has made it financially easier for the family.

loans.use: to stock up on inventory items for her store.

loans.name: Greyda Catalina

texts.es: La señora Greyda Catalina R. habita en el municipio de Ticuantepe, mujer tabajadora, su esposa la apoya en todos su proyectos ya que para los dos lo mas importante son sus hijas, ella tiene su propio negocio y el trabaja como mecanico, su mayor sueño es terminar su casa y mejorar sus condicones de vida. ella tiene su propio negocio, vende ropa usada  y gracias a sus clientes a salido adelante, con este nuevo credito comprara paca de Ropa para sufragar las demandas de sus clientes, y obtener mejores y mayores ingresos. Agradece a Afodenic y Fondos Kiva por la confianza brindada.
texts.en: Greyda Catalina lives in the town of Ticuantepe.  She is a hardworking woman and her husband helps her with all her projects.  Their daughters are their highest priority.  She has her own business and he works as a mechanic.  Their greatest dream is to finish their home and improve their living conditions.  She has her own business, selling used clothing and, thanks to her customers, she is successful.  With this new loan, she will buy bales of clothing to meet her customers’ requests, and earn better and higher income. She thanks Afodenic and Kiva funds for their confidence in her.  .

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothing.

loans.name: Sureydi Marioli

texts.en: Sureydi is an 18-year-old single mother. Her son Adrian was born with a cleft lip and is now 1 1/2 years old. Cleft lip is a medical condition that makes it difficult for children to eat or speak. Many also face social discrimination and are unable to attend school as a result. Sureydi lacks the financial resources to seek medical assistance for her son. She and Adrian live with her parents who work as farmers in a rural indigenous community. This loan will help her pay for life-changing corrective surgery for Adrian, vastly improving his quality of life and future opportunities.

loans.use: get corrective surgery for her son's cleft lip

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en: On September 1 1965, Daniel was discharged from the Guatemalan Army. On that day, when his platoon and he where traveling via military truck, they were ambushed by the guerrillas using incendiary grenades causing severe burn burns. Mr. Daniel received primary care in the army, but was left with residual burn deformity that limits the function and movement of his neck, lower lip and hand due to  burn contractures. This loan will be used for corrective plastic reconstructive surgery to improve his mobility.

loans.use: improve the motion of his neck, lip and hand

loans.name: René Ovidio

texts.en: Rene, his parents, and two siblings, all work in their small family-run business. They sell toys, school supplies and non-perishable food products to local community members from their home. A few years ago Rene's mother was ironing the family's clothes when, in a brief moment, wanting to assist his mother, Rene grabbed the hot iron severely burning his index finger. In time this cause his finger to curl into his hand because of the resultant burn scar contracture. As a result Rene is unable to grasp different objects securely with his left hand. This loan will enable reconstructive plastic surgery to restore his hand function including the use of tools.

loans.use: get corrective surgery for a burn contracture on his left index finger

loans.name: Imelda Virginia

texts.en: A few years ago, Imelda's daughter Jamilet, now 4 years old, was playing in the kitchen with fire when unexpectedly the fire exploded severely burning Jamilet.  She has limited movement of her left arm and cannot raise it more than half way. Imelda is a single mother who supports her eight children by selling candies and gum. This loan will help her pay for corrective surgery for her daughter to allow her normal function, vastly improving her quality of life and future opportunities. It is anticipated that a single surgery will completely restore her arm movement.

loans.use: restore physical movement of her arm after severe burns

loans.name: Rabia

texts.en:
Mrs Rabia is a 31-year-old, married woman. For the past five years, she has been successfully running a milk shop, where she sells milk and yogurt to the people of her community. Over time, Rabia has become famous in her area for providing good, quality milk. She counts a good client list and makes enough to contribute to her family's income. Her husband is employed in a textile mill, but his income, alone, is not sufficient to meet the needs of the family members.

Rabia wants to grow her business, so she requested a loan of Rs. 35,000 from Kashf Foundation. She will use it to purchase one more buffalo, along with some utensils for her shop, such as bowls and bottles. She is in her fifth loan cycle and has a good repayment history. She expects a boost in her earnings with her loan, and she plans to spend her profits on expanding her business further.

loans.use: to purchase one more buffalo, along with some utensils for her shop, such as bowls and bottles

loans.name: Sakina

texts.en:
Mrs Sakina is a 28-year-old, married woman. She has been successfully running a salad stall in her community for the past ten years, with the support of her husband. By this time, she has become well-known for providing fresh quality salad, and she earns a sufficient amount of income to contribute significantly to the family income.  She is a mother of four children and is motivated to provide for her family.

As she wants to grow her business, she requested a loan of Rs. 30,000. She will use it to buy a stock of vegetables, such as cucumbers, carrots and onions, from the market at lower prices.  In this way she would be able to cater to more customers daily. She expects a boost in her earnings and wishes to spend part of the income on the expansion of her business, in the near future. Sakina has been in association with Kashf Foundation since six years ago, and she has shown excellent repayment behavior.

loans.use: to buy a stock of vegetables, such as cucumbers, carrots and onions, from the market at lower prices

loans.name: Fernanda

texts.es:
La señora Fernanda tiene una tienda de barrio en su domicilio, su nivel de educación es  primaria, vive en casa de propia ocupando 3  habitaciones en un acabado de ladrillo y piso de machimbre en la ciudad de La Paz.
Fernanda atiende su tienda más de  8 horas al día, para cubrir sus gastos de alimentación, luz, agua, educación de su hija y otros

El crédito lo requiere para el aumento de su capital de trabajo; comprará insumos como ser harina, azúcar, fideo y otros para surtir su tienda y ofrecer sus productos a sus clientes.

El sueño de Fernanda es ampliar su negocio.

Es la segunda vez con IMPRO y la primera con Kiva.
texts.en:
Sra. Fernanda manages a neighborhood store in her home. She has a primary level education. Fernanda lives in her own home, which consists of three rooms made of brick with wooden plank floors. The house is located in the city of La Paz.

Fernanda looks after her store for more than eight hours a day. She is able to pay for expenses such as food, electricity, water, her daughter’s education, and other items. The loan she is requesting will increase her operating capital. She will able to buy merchandise such as flour, sugar, noodles, and other products for her store that can be offered to her customers.

Fernanda dreams of expanding her business. This is the second time she has worked with IMPRO, but the first time with Kiva.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, noodles, and other products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fabric, lace, thread, and a new sewing machine.

loans.name: Murad

texts.en:
Mrs Murad is a 39-year-old, married woman.  She has been in the business of rice selling for the past two years. She has become famous in her community for providing the best quality rice. Her husband is employed in a small factory, but he earns insufficient income to support his family alone. Murad is a mother of six children and is motivated to provide for her family.

As she wants to grow her business, she requested a loan of Rs 30,000. She will use it to buy a stock of rice, of various kinds, from the market at lower rates. With this inventory, she will be able to meet the increasing demand, consistently. She is in her fifth loan cycle and has shown excellent repayment behavior. She wishes to use part of her increased revenues to deal with personal expenses, and part to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy a stock of rice, of various kinds, from the market at lower rates.

loans.name: Nazia

texts.en:
Ms. Nazia is a 29-year-old married woman and mother of three children. The man shown in the photo is Nazia’s husband, who is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family's expenses, but now the rickshaw requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine. 

For this reason, Nazia has applied for a loan of Rs 30,000 for her husband. He wants to buy new tires for his vehicle. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better transport service to his passengers. Nazia is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to buy new tires for her husband's vehicle.

loans.name: Tasleem

texts.en:
Mrs Tasleem is a 51-year-old, married woman, who is living with her three children in Punjab, Pakistan. For about seven years she has been working in hand embroidery. She makes beautiful patterns for the people of her community. Her designs are much in demand, and she has managed to consolidate a clientele that allows her to contribute to covering the expenses of her home.

To help her to continue her operations, she has requested a loan of Rs. 35,000. She will use it to buy spools of thread in different colors, and packs of beads, sequins and stones, for embellishment. In this way, she will be able to cater to more customers, consistently. She is hoping to get an increase in her income, by targeting more customers. Tasleem dreams of her children's bright future and is very much thankful to Kashf for its tremendous support.

loans.use: to buy spools of thread in different colors, and packs of beads, sequins and stones, for embellishment.

loans.name: Tashkilat

texts.en:
Tashkilat is a 58-year-old man, married, with three children. He raises fruits and vegetables in his garden and has been doing it for the last 15 years. He is a very experienced farmer and has deep knowledge of the land and how to operate it. He was not able to find a job for several years and then decided to start his own business. 
 
Tashkilat usually raises seasonal fruits and vegetables and sells them for a profitable price in the central bazaar. Fresh fruits and vegetables are very popular and in high demand because people prefer to eat every day and consider them very healthy. Also, one of the favorite national dishes, Dolma, is made of fresh eggplants, peppers, and tomatoes. 

Tashkilat's monthly income from this business is AZN 120. This is only one source of income in his family. His older son helps him.

Now Tashkilat would like to invest more capital in his business and purchase seeds and fertilizer. For this purpose, he applied for a loan of AZN 1000. This is only one source of income in his family and he hopes this loan will improve the lives of his family.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Sanan

texts.en:
Sanan is 45 years old and married with three children. He breeds cattle and sells them for meat purposes to local butchers. Sanan has 10 years of experience in this field, thanks to his father who taught him the best how to look after cattle. Hard life conditions and unemployment pushed him to start his own business. 
Sanan usually buys small calves and raises and fattens them in five to six months. Then he resells them for profit at the local livestock bazaar. Meat selling brings him 100 AZN income per month. People use beef in everyday national dishes as pilau and dolma and always use yogurt sauce. 

This is the only income in his family and not enough to cover basic needs of his beloved children. Xaqani applied for a loan of 1000 AZN to purchase three baby calves, one cow and fodder. This will be his second loan and Sanan has a very positive client history.

loans.use: to buy three baby calves, one cow and fodder

loans.name: Maria Jose

texts.es:
La joven María  es una persona emprendedora  honesta  y seria, vive con sus  2 hijos y hermanos   en el  sur de Honduras. Su negocio es la  venta  de tortillas.
Doña María el préstamo lo necesita para la compra de  maíz, leña y cal.  Con el préstamo espera que las ventas en su negocio aumenten al tener más mercancía que ofrecer a los clientes y cubrir las necesidades de los mismos y con esto mejorar la situación  económica. 
Doña María espera que a un corto plazo su negocio siga  creciendo y  consolidándose  para que se convierta en la más grande  rentable y  reconocido de su colonia. Y seguir  apoyando a sus hijos y  hermanos para que se conviertan en personas honesta  con principios y valores.




Choluteca, Honduras –  Febrero  del   2013
texts.en:
María is an enterprising, honest, and serious young person.  She lives with her two children and siblings in the south of Honduras.  Her business is selling tortillas.

María needs the loan to buy corn, firewood, and lime.  With the loan she hopes her business sales will increase and she'll have more merchandise to sell to her customers and cover their needs and so improve her economic situation.

María hopes that in the short term her business will continue growing and getting stronger and become the biggest, most profitable, and best known in her community.  She also hopes to continue supporting her children and siblings so they become honest people with principles and values.

Choluteca, Honduras, February 2013

loans.use: to buy corn, firewood, and lime

loans.name: Upendo-Oysterbay Group

texts.en:
Zuhura is in her late 20s, married and has four children who are all going to school. She has been running a clothing shop for three years now.  She works from 6 a.m. to 10 p.m. daily and is able to make a very good monthly profit. 

This will be Zuhura's first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She wants to use the loan to buy more clothes for her shop. Her dream is to one day be able to build her own house.

Zuhura will share this loan with her loan group "Upendo-Oysterbay," which has 12 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for her clothes shop.

loans.name: Agamir

texts.en:
Agamir is 36 years old, married and has one daughter. He is a market vendor and sells different kinds of food products in the central bazaar. Agamir has four years of experience in this field and is considered a knowledgeable and skilled person.

He usually sells rice, macaroni, yogurt, ketchup, sugar and other items. He sells products that are in very high demand and people use them in everyday life. These products are in very high demand among local people and his monthly profit is 120 AZN. His spouse helps him to update merchandise in his shop. 

This business provides the only income for his family. Agamir would like to increase his sales as well as to cover market demand. For this purpose, he applied for a loan of 1500 AZN.  He will use this loan to purchase more products.  He has already demonstrated himself to be a good client with a positive credit history.

loans.use: to buy more food products to increase sales

loans.name: Al-Amira Group

texts.en:
Al-Amira group consists of three women from Taiz, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 180,000 YER from AMB.
Amira is the leader of the group. She is a 26-year-old single woman. She did not complete her education, studying up to secondary school. She lives in small house that is very uncomfortable for her and relatives. Unfortunately, she doesn't have the money to buy a water tank for her house. Therefore, she asked for a loan of 60,000 YER. In the future, she looks forward to finishing her house so that she can provide better living conditions for herself and her family.

loans.use: to buy a water tank for her house

loans.name: Rafia

texts.en:
Mrs Rafia is a 50-year-old, married woman. She has been in business selling fruits, for the past two years, with the support of her husband. The man shown with Rafia in the photo is her husband. She is very enthusiastic in her business and manages to earn a reasonable amount of money to help support her family. She is a loving mother of three children and is responsible for their food, health and education.

For the improvement of her business, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of Rs. 25,000. She will use it to purchase sacks of apples, mangoes and guavas. This will help her to meet the market demand consistently, which ultimately will help her to generate more cash.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of apples, mangoes and guavas, to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy agricultural products

loans.name: Shirinbayim

texts.en:
Shirinbayim is a 55-year-old woman on a pension. She is married and has three adult sons. She started her business 16 years ago, because of her small pension. Her monthly income is 120 AZN. Her husband helps her to purchase and bring the stock to the shop. Now she sells women's clothes in the bazaar, and she wants to renew her stock by purchasing clothes for Spring season. With the national spring holidays, Novruz, approaching, she needs to invest in a new collection of women's clothes. 

She applied for 2,000 AZN, which she will use to purchase new clothes and an updated spring collection. This will be her fourth loan, and she has a good client history.

loans.use: to buy new seasonal clothes, for her spring collection

loans.name: Shahbaz

texts.en:
Shahbaz owns a small cellphone shop in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. He is 37 years old and is a responsible father of nine children. Due to his large family size, he is going through serious financial problems. He wants to provide education and a better life for his children, but because of high school fees and increased market rates, he finds it very difficult. 

Shahbaz wants to generate more income by increasing his cell phone-selling shop. For that, he has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan, to purchase the latest cell phones and a variety of cell phone accessories, including cell phone casings, hands free sets, data cables, and Bluetooth. With the help of the loan, he hopes for a great increase in his net income and savings. 

Mr. Shahbaz is very thankful to the all staff of Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase the latest cell phones and a variety of cell phone accessories to sell.

loans.name: Nazia

texts.en:
Nazia is a 34-year-old married woman. She is a loving mother of four children and is responsible for their food, health and education. She is trying hard to fulfill their basic necessities through her business. 

She has been selling eggs for the past six years with the support of her husband and has a regular list of customers. She is very enthusiastic about her business and manages to earn a reasonable amount of money to support her family. 

For the improvement for her business, she contacted the Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of Rs. 45,000 to purchase more eggs to increase her sales. This will help her to meet market demands consistently, which will help in generating more cash.

loans.use: to purchase more eggs to increase her sales.

loans.name: Maria Elsa

texts.es: La señora Maria, habita en el municipio de Masaya, su esposo la apoya en todo ya que su mayor sueño es terminar su casa y mejorar de condiciones, sus hijas tambien tambien la apoyan, ella trabaja como laboratorista en el Hospital del Municipio, con este nuevo credito comprara los materiales necesarios para continuar  con la construccion: Cemento, Arena, Hierro con esto realizara parte del muro de su casa ya que  requiere de seguridad y privacidad. Agradece el Apoyo incondicional que Afodenic y Fondos Kiva le han brindado.
texts.en:
María lives in the city of Masaya. Her husband supports her in everything, and her biggest dream is to finish their house and improve their conditions. Their daughters are supportive of her, too. María works as a laboratory technician in the municipal hospital. 

With this new loan, María will buy the necessary materials to continue with the construction: cement, sand, and rebar. With those, she will build part of the wall around her house, since they need security and privacy. She is grateful for the unconditional support that Afodenic and Kiva have provided to her.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials.

loans.name: Asifa

texts.en:
Asifa is a 33-year-old, vigorous lady. She has been stitching clothes for many years. She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to lack of availability of funds, she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. 

For this reason, Asifa requested a loan of PKR 15,000 from Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan to buy more spools of thread in different colors, along with packs of laces, zippers, and buttons, to create a means of increasing revenue, so she may be able to generate a healthier source of income. She is thankful to Kashf Foundation for its tremendous support.

loans.use: to buy more spools of thread in different colors, along with packs of laces, zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Bibi-Saleema

texts.en: Bibi-Saleema is a 34-year-old married woman. For the past 10 years, she has been successfully running a business of selling milk. Her husband has a job, but his income is not sufficient to meet the household expenses alone. Therefore, she makes a major contribution in supporting her family. She has four children, all of whom attend school. She is very motivated to provide them with a beautiful life and with a good education, food and clothing.  She has improved her business to meet the day to day expenses of life. In order to purchase one cow, she requested a loan of Rs. 20,000 to increase the production capacity of milk. In this way, she would be able to cater to more customers, which will ultimately help in generating more cash.

loans.use: to purchase one cow.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Ms Nasreen, 51 years old and married, has been running an animal sales business for many years. She buys animals (baby goats and calves) at low prices, raising them to sell in the market at higher prices. She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf foundation, and currently has two goats.

Nasreen has requested a loan of Rs. 20,000 to purchase one more goat. She hopes to grow her business, and dreams of giving a good quality education to her children through all of her hard work.

loans.use: to purchase one more goat.

loans.name: Sadaf

texts.en: Ms. Sadaf is a 20-year-old married lady and a mother of two. She has been in the beauty parlor business for the past six months. She offers many services to her customers, such as makeup, hair styling and facials. Through providing the best services, she has become very famous in her community. Her husband is a barber. She availed a first loan from Kashf Foundation last year for her husband’s barber shop, which is running well. As she herself took the initiative to start her own business six months ago, she now needs capital for her own business and availed a loan of PKR 30,000 for her parlor. She intends to use this loan amount to buy hair care products, skin products and creams for bleaching and whitening in large quantities. She is hopeful to cater more customers repeatedly and to have a great financial contribution to her family.

loans.use: to buy hair care products, skin products and creams for bleaching and whitening in large quantities.

loans.name: Shahnaz

texts.en:
Shahnaz has expertise in embroidery and has been using her skill to provide for her family for over six years now. She started this line of work after her marriage. During the initial years of her business she barely made enough money to purchase the required material. Today she is proud to be famous in her community for being the best at making beautiful patterns with thread and beads. 

Five years ago, when she borrowed from Kashf for the first time, she wanted to purchase embroidery material. Currently she has requested another loan of Rs 30,000 to purchase more beads, threads and sequins in different colors. 

She says that the females in her community are becoming demanding with the passage of time and satisfying them is a challenge that Shahnaz has taken up. Her daughters also assist her in completing the orders on time.

loans.use: to purchase more beads, threads and sequins in different colors.

loans.name: Phatain

texts.en:
Phatain is a 49-year-old married woman and a mother of two children. She has been successfully running a small general store with her son at the corner of her house. The man shown in the photo is Phatains’s son, who assists her by purchasing goods from the market. She has two years of experience in this field. 

She wants to grow her business so she requested a loan of PKR 20,000 to buy rice, flour and sugar. In this way they will be able to meet the demands of their customers without fail. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy rice, flour and sugar to sell in her store.

loans.name: Alfonso Alberto

texts.es:
El señor Alfonso Alberto vive en la cuidad de Managua, trabaja como higienista en un mercado de la cápital desde hace nueve años. Padre de familia responsable, respetuoso con dos hijos en edad escolar.


Está  solicitando un crédito para invertirlos en gastos escolares para sus hijos, y hacerles el cambio de  techo a su vivienda.

Don Alfonzo está muy agradecido con kiva-ceprodel porque gracias a los crédito obtenido ha mejorado su vivienda  y esto le ha permitido darles una mejor calidad de vida a su familia ya que él es pilar principal para sacar a su familia adelante
texts.en: Alfonso Alberto lives in Managua.  He has worked for nine years as a hygienist in a market in the capital.   He is a responsible, respectable father of two school-age children.  He is requesting the loan to invest in education expenses for his children, and to replace his home’s roof.  Alfonzo is very grateful to Ceprodel and Kiva because, thanks to the awarded loan, he has improved his home.  This has permitted him to provide his family with a better quality of life as he is the mainstay that gets his family ahead.

loans.use: to purchase zinc and purlins and pay education expenses.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.pt:
Casada e mãe de 5 filhos, dos quais 4 ainda frequentam Escola, vive na casa própria e não sustenta mais ninguém para além dos filhos.
É comerciante vende frangos de corte e com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar pintos, ração, vitaminas para aumentar a quantidade da sua criação.
No futuro deseja ampliar a sua casa e casar-se oficialmente, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é aumentar a sua renda familiar e garantir uma boa saúde para os membros dos mesmos.
texts.en:
Julieta is married and has five children, four of whom still attend school. She lives in a house she owns and doesn't support anyone else other than her children.
She's a merchant who sells broiler chickens. With the current loan she intends to purchase chicks, feed and vitamins in order to increase the number of chickens she raises.
Her wish for the future is to enlarge her house and make her marriage official. For that reason she pledges to repay the loan as scheduled, so she can request more loans from Hluvuku.
The challenge she faces is increasing her family income and ensuring good health for her family members.

loans.use: to purchase chicks, feed and vitamins in order to increase the number of chickens she raises.

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
Parveen is a 43-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband. She has two years of experience in this field. Her husband assists her by purchasing goods from the market. She is a mother of two and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing and health. 

She wants to grow her business so she requested a loan of PKR 20,000 to buy packs of salt, biscuits and oil to meet the increasing demand at her store. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of salt, biscuits and oil to meet the increasing demand at her store.

loans.name: Azhran

texts.en:
Azhran is a 55-year-old, energetic married woman and a mother of four. She works from home as a tailor and has been doing this for the past five years. She sews for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. 

However, due to a lack of availability of funds she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers, which keep changing according to the new fashions and trends. For this reason, she requested a loan of Rs 20,000 from Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan to buy more spools of threads in different colors, along with the packs of laces, zippers and buttons to generate a healthier source of income. She hopes to have a good experience with the new loan.

loans.use: to buy thread, lace, zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.pt:
Casado e pai de 3 filhos, que ainda frequentam Escola, vive na casa própria e não sustenta mais ninguém para além dos filhos.
É supervisor numa empresa privada e com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar material de construção (chapas de zincos, janelas, cimento e outros) para fazer acabamentos da sua casa.
No futuro gostaria de construir uma mini mercearia e um salão de cabeleireiro para sua esposa, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é aumentar o valor dos seus empréstimos para poder satisfazer os seus projectos.
texts.en:
Francisco is married and has three children who still attend school. He lives in a house he owns and doesn't support anyone else other than his children.
He's a supervisor for a private company. With the current loan he intends to purchase construction supplies (metal sheets, windows, cement, etc.) in order to do finishing work on his house.
He would like to someday build a small grocery store and a hair salon for his wife. For that reason he pledges to repay the loan as scheduled, so he can request more loans from Hluvuku.
The challenge he faces is increasing the amount of his loans so he can accomplish his projects.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies (metal sheets, windows, cement, etc.) in order to do finishing work on his house.

loans.name: Safia

texts.en: Ms. Safia is a 30-year-old lady; she has been in the beauty parlor business for the past two years. She offers many services to her customers, such as makeup, hair styling and facials. Through providing the best services, she has become very famous on her street. In order to meet with the increasing demands of her customers, she is interested in buying more varieties of cosmetic products for the parlor.  But because of having a low amount of cash in hand, she contacted Kashf Foundation to apply for her first loan. She needs a loan of Rs 20,000 to buy hair care products, skin products and creams for bleaching and whitening in large quantities. She is hopeful to cater to more customers time after time. She wishes to spend part of the profits on the expansion of her business.

loans.use: to buy hair care products, skin products and creams for bleaching and whitening in large quantities.

loans.name: Gjyste

texts.en:
A loan of 150,000 Albanian Lek will help Gjyste to build a stable for her animals.
 
Gjyste has been in the animal husbandry line of work for the past fifteen years, and this has been the only source of income for the family. 

Gjyste is in her late 40’s. She is married and has three children, and all of them live in rural northern Albania. She has been left to take care of the animals, milking, feeding them, etc. However, the other members of the family have been helping out as well. Usually livestock care in the rural areas is an activity for all family members.

loans.use: To build a stable for her animals

loans.name: Mirash

texts.en:
Mirash is a 59-year-old villager living in northern Albania, and he is married with three grownup children.

Mirash has been operating his agriculture and livestock business for twenty-two years, and according to him, he has been enjoying it. All of their family, including the children and his wife, are involved in this activity. “Going all alone it can be extremely tiresome. So, everyone needs to pitch in to make it easier.”, Mirash said. “We have been selling milk, baby animals and fresh agricultural produce, such as veggies and grains mostly, and through such sales we have been earning a good income", he continued.

The loan that Mirash is requesting from Kiva lenders will be used for agriculture: preparing the land for planting, and buying seeds and fertilizers, etc.

loans.use: To prepare the land for planting and buy seeds and fertilizers, etc.

loans.name: Bonifacio

texts.pt:
Casado e pai de 5 filhos, 2 dos quais ainda frequentam Escola, vive na casa própria e não sustenta mais ninguém para além dos filhos.
É engenheiro civil de profissão, trabalha nos transportes REMANE e com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar material de construção (areia, barrotes, chapas de zincos, cimento e outros) para fazer acabamentos de cobertura e reboco da sua casa.
No futuro gostaria de concluir a sua residência e desenvolver actividades de geração de renda, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é pagar o mais urgente para poder solicitar mais crédito em pouco tempo.
texts.en:
Bonifacio is married and has five children, two of whom still attend school. He lives in a house he owns and doesn't support anyone else other than his children.
He's a civil engineer by trade and works for a transportation company named REMANE. With the current loan he intends to purchase construction supplies (sand, beams, metal sheets, cement, etc.) in order to finish the roof and the plaster in his house.
He would like to someday finish his house and start an income-generating business. For that reason he pledges to repay the loan as scheduled, so he can request more loans from Hluvuku.
The challenge he faces is repaying the loan as quickly as possible so he can request another loan very soon.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies (sand, beams, metal sheets, cement, etc.) in order to finish the roof and the plaster in his house.

loans.name: Griselda

texts.en:
Griselda is a 24-year-old single woman, who has been running her own hair salon for the past two years. She grew up in Greece and about four years ago her family including her came back to reside in their native village. Right way, she went to study at the Academy of Estheticians in the capital city of Albania for the profession of esthetician and hairdressing.

“I take pleasure of helping others enjoy their life and this is why I chose this field. I also like to work independently, and running my own salon has given me that opportunity.” Griselda said.

Even though she has been operating the salon for almost two years, she is happy with the income, she expressed. Now she needs a loan to buy some items needed in her profession.

loans.use: to buy neccessary tools for her esthetician craft

loans.name: Utuie

texts.en: Utuie is 44 years old and is married with 3 children. She has a small garden where she grows taro and bananas that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for 3 years. Utuie needs a loan to buy equipment and to pay some boys to help her with her business. She has been a member of SPBD since 2011. Utuie will use the profits from her sales to purchase new land to extend her own business in the future.

loans.use: to buy a wheel barrow, bush knives, shovels, and fertilizers.

loans.name: Siara

texts.en: Ms. Siara is a 25-year-old married woman. She has had a business for one year manufacturing elastic that is used in sewing clothes and baby’s garments. She has become famous for providing good quality material in her community. Siara operates the machine at home by herself. Her husband is employed in water supply management, with a low income. Siara is a mother of three children, among them two who are school-going. She is trying hard to meet the needs of her family members. She also does sewing as a part-time job. In this way, she is able to manage the household more efficiently. This is her first year with Kashf Foundation. She has applied for a loan of PKR 20,000 to buy another machine for making elastic, to increase her sales. She expects a boost in her earning from her larger sales.

loans.use: to buy another machine and increase her production and sales of elastic that is used in sewing clothes and baby’s garments.

loans.name: Nuon

texts.en:
Nuon is a 57-year-old father who has three children living together in Kompong Speu province. He is a primary school teacher in the public sector, earning a decent salary to nourish his family. He has been in this occupation for more than 30 years. In spite of working full time at school, Nuon also works in agriculture in his paddy fields alongside his spouse.
 
The loan that he is requesting will be used to purchase a motorcycle for home use. Also, he will utilize the rest of funds to build a bathroom, so that he can keep his family in healthy conditions. The loan will help him to satisfy their daily needs and cut down on unnecessary expenses. His dream is to have money to invest in a grocery store operating in his neighborhood.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle for home use.

loans.name: Puna

texts.en: Puna is a 37-year-old married woman with 5 children. She has a small plantation and grows bananas to earn a living. She has been doing this for 3 years. Puna has requested a loan to buy fertilizer and some equipment for her business. She has been a member of SPBD since 2010. With her profits, Puna hopes to expand her business and to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, bush knives, and a wheel barrow.

loans.name: Feagai

texts.en: Feagiai is a 21-year-old married woman with no children. She would like to start growing vegetables to earn a living. Feagiai has requested a loan to buy equipment and seeds to start her business. She has been a member of SPBD for 1 year. Feagiai will spend her profits to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy veggie seeds, fertilizers, and shovels.

loans.name: Rukhsana

texts.en: Ms. Rukhsana is a 40-year-old married woman. She has been sewing gloves for many years. She sews for the people of her community and also receives orders from the local market. Her husband works in a service station for daily wages, and his income is not sufficient to support his family alone. Rukhsana has built a regular list of customers, and she makes enough to contribute to the family income. However, due to a lack of available funds, she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. For this reason, she has applied for a loan of PKR 20,000 from Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this amount to buy a new sewing machine and spools of thread, to create a means of increasing revenues so she can generate a healthier source of income.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine and spools of thread for her business.

loans.name: Aquino

texts.pt:
Casado e pai de 3 filhos, que já não frequentam Escola, vive na casa própria e não sustenta mais ninguém.
É pensionista militar e possui um negócio de criação e venda de frangos de corte. Com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar pintos, ração, vitaminas e vacinas para aumentar a quantidade ou volume do negocio.
No futuro deseja expandir a sua actividade para outras zonas, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é aumentar os seus aviários para fazer crescer ainda mais a sua actividade.
texts.en:
Aquino is married and has three children who no longer attend school. He lives in a house he owns and doesn't support anyone else.
He's a military pensioner and owns a business raising and selling broiler chickens. With the current loan he intends to purchase chicks, feed, vitamins and vaccines in order to expand his business or increase turnover.
His wish for the future is to expand his business onto other areas. For that reason he pledges to repay the loan as scheduled, so he can request more loans from Hluvuku.
The challenge he faces is enlarging his aviary in order to make his business grow even more.

loans.use: to purchase chicks, feed, vitamins and vaccines in order to expand his business or increase turnover.

loans.name: Jameela

texts.en: Ms. Jameela is a 50-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store at the corner of her house for a year. Her husband assists her by purchasing stocks of goods from the market, as he has maintained many contacts through the years. She makes enough through her business to meet the needs of her four children. She wants to grow her business, so she has applied for a loan of PKR 25,000 to buy packs of salt, biscuits and beverages to meet the increasing demand at her store. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of salt, biscuits and beverages for her general store.

loans.name: Zareena

texts.en: Ms. Zareena is a 28-year-old married woman and the mother of three children. She has been running a business trading in clothes for many years. She buys a variety of clothes from the main city and then sells to the people of her neighborhood. She has become famous for selling good quality clothes in her community. Zareena has applied for a loan of PKR 25,000 from Kashf Foundation to buy a stock of different clothes for the summer season, taking into account the choices and tastes of her customers. In this way, she would be able to earn more income through greater sales. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan and wants to grow her business. She dreams of giving a good quality education to her children through all her hard work in her business.

loans.use: to buy a stock of summer clothes for her business, taking into account the choices and tastes of her customers.

loans.name: Kinyarwanda Kweteranahamwe Group

texts.en: Justus is married and has three children, one of whom goes to school. He is a peasant farmer, growing pigs, poultry and crops. Justus went into the farming business five years ago, as a source of income to look after his family plus raising food for home consumption. He has applied for a loan of UGX 500,000 (five hundred thousand Ugandan shillings) through the group, to expand on his farming projects. Justus’s dream is to buy more land to expand his farm and also to buy a motorcycle to ease his transport. His main challenges include limited capital, poor transport to get his goods to market, and market price fluctuations for agricultural products. He thanks the group members for standing there for each other and UGAFODE Microfinance for trusting them with the money, especially in an area where they are foreigners. They hope the partnership will persist.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and hire labor for his farm.

loans.name: Zacarias

texts.pt:
Casado e pai de 6 filhos, 2 dos quais ainda frequentam Escola, vive na casa própria e não sustenta mais ninguém.
É operário e trabalha numa empresa de produção e venda de banana, também possui uma área própria onde pretende desenvolver sua actividade agrícola. Com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar uma motobomba para irrigar os seus campos de produção.
No futuro deseja expandir a sua área de cultivo, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é liquidar o empréstimo o mais rápido para solicitar mais.
texts.en:
Zacarias is married and has six children, two of whom still attend school. He lives in a house he owns and doesn't support anyone else.
He's a laborer and works for a banana production company. He also owns a plot of land where he intends to start a farming business. With the current loan he intends to purchase a water pump in order to irrigate his farmland.
His wish for the future is to expand his farming area. For that reason he pledges to repay the loan as scheduled, so he can request more loans from Hluvuku.
The challenge he faces is repaying the loan as quickly as possible in order to request more loans.

loans.use: to purchase a water pump in order to irrigate his farmland.

loans.name: Emma Saturnina

texts.es: Doña Emma de 41 años de edad vive junto a su compañero de vida en casa propia, ella se dedica a la compra y venta de frutas fresas, papaya, piñas, naranjas, entre otros tiene varios años con el negocio y eso le ha regalado mucha experiencia en las ventas que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, el lugar donde comercia es muy estratégico para la actividad y además muy concurrido de personas, ya tiene mucha clientela que la prefiere porque su producto es fresco, a buen precio, de calidad y con un excelente servicio,doña Emma solicita un crédito que le permita comprar mas frutas para poder obtener mejores ganancias y asi darle a su familia una mejor vida.
texts.en:
Emma, 41, lives with her life partner in her own house.

She earns a living buying and selling strawberries, papaya, pineapple, oranges, and other fruits.  She has had the business for several years, which has granted her a lot of sales experience that allows her to get the best profits.  The place she sells is very strategic for the job and also busy with people.  She has a lot of customers who prefer her because her products are fresh, affordable, and high quality, and her service is excellent.

Emma's requesting a loan to buy more fruit to get better profits and give her family a better life.

loans.use: to buy fruit

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy used spare parts and scrap metal

loans.name: Ana

texts.pt:
Casada e mãe de 6 filhos, 1 dos quais ainda frequentam Escola, vive na casa própria e sustenta 2 netos que vivem com ela.
É comerciante e dona do próprio negócio de venda de produtos diversos. Com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar produtos (refrescos, açúcar, farinha, amendoim e outros) para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria.
No futuro deseja fazer dependências em sua residência para poder alugar, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
Sem nenhum desafio de momento.
texts.en:
Ana is married and has six children, one of whom still attends school. She lives in a house she owns and supports two grandchildren who live with her.
She's a merchant and owns her own business selling various products. With the current loan she intends to purchase goods (refreshments, sugar, flour, peanuts, etc.) in order to stock up with merchandise.
Her wish for the future is to build rooms in her house so she can rent them out. For that reason she pledges to repay the loan as scheduled, so she can request more loans from Hluvuku.
She doesn't face any challenges at the moment.

loans.use: to purchase goods (refreshments, sugar, flour, peanuts, etc.) for selling.

loans.name: Susy Amparito

texts.es:
La Clienta Susy vive en Libertad, ella tiene 41 años de edad.
Ella inicio primero vendiendo ropa interior, pero cuando falleció su padre decidió vender ropa variada, camisas, blusas, vestidos, porque  tenía que tener más dinero para sustentar los gastos de su hogar.
Ella vende su mercadería de lunes a sábado desde las 9:00 de la mañana hasta las 17:00 de la tarde. A ella se le presentan dos problemas en su trabajo la falta de dinero para la compra de mercadería y los ladrones que intentan hacer daño en el barrio. 
Ella no tiene esposo, ni tampoco tiene hijos.
Con el préstamo ella va a comprar mercadería para su negocio: blusas, camisa, vestidos.
Su sueño es tener su local propio, que este en su casa para estar mas cómodo y no estar ambulante corriendo riesgos.
texts.en:
Susy, age 41, lives in Libertad.  She first started selling underwear.  However, when her father died she decided to sell various clothing, shirts, blouses, and dresses.  She did this because she had to have more money to cover the household expenses.

She sells her merchandise Mondays through Saturdays from 9:00 a.m. until 5:00 p.m.  She is facing two problems in her work.  The problems are the lack of money to buy merchandise and the thieves that are trying to do damage to the neighborhood.

She does not have a husband, nor does she have any children.

She will use the loan to buy merchandise for her business.  She will buy blouses, shirts, and dresses.

Her dream is to have her own place at her house.  She wants this in order to be more comfortable and to not run the risks of selling in an itinerant manner.

loans.use: to buy clothing like blouses, shirts, and dresses.

loans.name: Sum

texts.en: Sum has been a farmer for almost ten years, growing and harvesting rice and soybeans to sell. Her four children always help her with her work, as she divorced her husband in the past five years. Sum would like to keep growing her current business by investing additional capital. Due to the lack of funds, she is seeking a loan from Kiva lenders in the sum of KHR 2,000,000. She will use it to purchase seeds and cover her operating costs. She hopes that she will be able to have an abundant harvest in the coming season. Her personal plans include saving for her children's future education.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and cover her operating costs.

loans.name: Hourn

texts.en:
Hourn is from the small village of Krong Siem Reap, Siem Reap province. Hourn has a family that is comprised of five members: her husband and four children. She is 39 years old and has been working as a cleaner since 2011, besides growing rice during rainy season.

As it is very difficult for her children to commute to their workplaces and to cover the daily costs of doing so, Hourn aspires to receive a loan from HKL and Kiva. Hourn will use the loan to buy a motorcycle, to encourage her employed children. This would enable them to get anywhere quickly and safely, by themselves. This loan is very important for her children, facilitating good transportation, and contributing to the betterment of their family's living conditions. Hourn dreams of having a grocery store in a local market of her area someday, where she could earn extra profit to supply to her family.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for use by her employed children.

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Sok is 31 years old and the father of three, school-aged children. To nourish and educate his children, Sok makes a great effort, working in his business as a construction worker, and also engaging in farming activities on his own farm. At a construction site he works at least 8 hours per day and gets his wage of USD 5.00 each day.  Despite his hardships, Sok wants to go far in his business and provide a happy life to his family members. He has been working in these fields, for years.

To help him reduce his operating costs in farming, Sok would like to borrow a loan. He will use it to purchase a couple of cows, for the maintenance of the rice paddy. He believes it will go well for him, because he will avoid hiring others' animals in each harvest season. This way, he'll be able to improve his profits and save more for the future emergencies of his family, as well as education for his children.

loans.use: to purchase a couple of cows, for the maintenance of the rice paddy.

loans.name: Bernanda De La Concepcion

texts.es:
Bernarda una humilde comerciante de 55 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de helados, frescos y hielos, originaria de Rivas, pero actualmente vive en Managua, casada, orgullosa madre de 6 hijos, mayores de edad, todos viven independiente. Inicio en el ámbito del comercio  a la edad de 38 años, vendiendo productos variado, ya que ella necesitaba un medio del cual subsistir y poder generar ingresos a diario, la cual se siente muy bien porque su negocio le genera ganancias a diario, ella como pueda se esfuerza cada día por agregar productos nuevo a su negocio para que le genere ingresos extras.
En su negocio recibe el apoyo de su esposo y su hija.  Bernarda está solicitando el financiamiento para comprar gaseosa, jugos, cereales, galletas, hielos, etc. Ella estima que este préstamo le ayudara a comprar todos los productos más demandado por sus clientes, uno de sus planes futuro es poder establecer otro negocio como es una fritanga (venta de comida frita).
texts.en:
Bernarda is a humble merchant, 55 years old. She works selling ice cream, fruit shakes and ices. She is originally from Rivas, but she currently lives in Managua. She is married and the proud mother of 6 children who are adults and all living independently. She started out in business at the age of 38, selling assorted products, since she needed a way of making a living and generating a daily income. She feels very good about this, because her business generates earnings every day. She works as best she can each day to add new products to her business in order to generate extra income. 

In her business, she has the support of her husband and her daughter. Bernarda is requesting the loan to buy soft drinks, juices, cereals, cookies, ices, etc. She judges that this loan will help her buy all of the products in greatest demand among her customers. One of her future plans is establishing another business, such as a "fritanga" (selling fried foods).

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, juices, cereals, cookies, ices, etc.

loans.name: Sin

texts.en:
Sin resides in her own home located in Kompong Speu Province. She is 46 years old and married with three grown-up children, two of whom have settled down away from home, while the last one is living with Sin under the same roof. Sin’s main business activity is growing rice. She cultivates her land and particularly harvests rice for food. Sin has a child and her husband to help her with the business in each coming season.

Having been working very hard for years on her own farm, Sin lacks animals to perform tasks in her paddy fields. To help her improve her business, Sin would like to take out a loan of 2,000,000 riels (KHR) to purchase a cow for the farm. She realizes that, with the help of the loan, she will be able to make her business more attainable and profitable. Sin plans to reinvest the increased income into the business and renovate her old house.

loans.use: to purchase a cow for farming.

loans.name: You

texts.en:
You is 37 years old and married. He lives with his wife and two children in Kompong Speu province. He and his wife are farmers, growing rice for food. You's earnings are really not enough to cover his family’s expenses. However, he has tried to work harder to basically provide his two children with further education. He believes that education is one of the keys to success in their lives and that it can break the poverty cycle.
You is now requesting a loan in order to buy a cow for the maintenance of his paddy fields. To do so, he can reduce the operational costs that he used to pay for animal hire fees in each harvest season. This loan will help him focus more on his crops. You's dream is to extend his farmland so as to better his profit.

loans.use: to buy a cow for the maintenance of his paddy fields.

loans.name: Fidel

texts.en:
Fidel is a 44-year-old male Ugandan who lives in the Rwamarengye-Rukungiri District. He is married with seven children and works with his family looking after the home and their businesses.
In particular, his business is nursery bed farming of different tree species and coffee trees where he sells seedlings to the local farmers and the government in cases of bulky arrangements. His farming practice acts as a demonstration farm to most farmers around the area and the country as a whole.
 With this practice, he has been able to look after his children, wife and all his dependents, especially his aged parents. With this loan from UGAFODE Microfinance Limited (MDI), he plans to inject the money into his nursery bed business in the form of organic fertilizers in order to gain higher returns.
Therefore he thanks UGAFODE Microfinance Limited (MDI) for the financial services rendered to him over this time.

Pictured is Fidel (right) with the UGAFODE credit officer at his nursery bed during appraisal.

loans.use: To buy organic fertilizers

loans.name: Pao

texts.en: Pao is 32 years old and lives with his long-term partner in Kompong Speu province. Together, they have one child who will be enrolled in school soon. Pao is in the business of farming rice just for an income, which hardly seems to fulfill his family's daily necessities. Additionally, he works to provide construction services with his team around the province. Due to the lack of a motorcycle for daily travelling and commuting, Pao decided to borrow a loan through HKL, one of Kiva partners, to purchase a motorbike for personal use. Also, he will utilize the rest of the fund to pay for laborers who are constructing his house. Last time, Pao just owned a palm house that was not comfortable for his family. Pao thanks the lenders that enable him to continuously develop his living standard. His dream is to work a lot for the well-being of his family.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for personal use

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David, 56, has a large family of eleven children; his oldest is 32 years and a local businessman in his local area.
In recent years, David has been working in poultry farming/business. He buys chicks and rears them until they are old enough for commercial consumption. He is now seeking a loan from UGAFODE Microfinance Limited (MDI) for the same cause. He is planning to buy more poultry chicks for rearing.
For a long time David has been able to survive on the savings he got from his poultry business, and also he has been able to educate his children through this project. His main challenges are chicken diseases and the high costs of feeds, yet consumers are not willing to pay an increased price.
David thanks UGAFODE Microfinance Limited (MDI) for the financial services they have given, especially to low income earners like him.

loans.use: To buy chicks that he will rear and later sell

loans.name: Chan

texts.en:
Chan has been a farmer, growing rice and vegetables for almost 10 years, and it has been her primary source of income for the family. She is married to a farmer and she has become a good mother of two children. Chan and her husband have a good cooperation, and at the moment they are quite busy with their vegetable farm where they work to provide good nutrition for their vegetables. Chan is very ambitious for her business and she dreams of having a bigger land size to cultivate more crops, so as to improve her standard of living.

Chan has been with HKL for a loan already and she successfully used her previous loan to improve her income. This will be her second loan cycle, which she will utilize to buy a farm animal to keep growing her current business. She hopes this loan will be a wise investment for her and that she can continue to upgrade her living status.

loans.use: to buy a farm animal to keep growing her current business.

loans.name: Henry

texts.en:
Henry was born in 1970 in Masya–Rukungiri District and is married with nine children.

He has been an agriculturalist since 1984. He carried out farming for quite a long time and later started a small bar/restaurant which he has depended on for income to educate his children and meet his family's needs.

He decided to join UGAFODE Microfinance Limited (MDI) for financial assistance in order to promote and increase his cattle fattening business. With this loan, Henry is going to buy more cows for rearing.  He sells the cows after some time of feeding to the required commercial market for consumption.  He is also planning to expand his bar/restaurant business by using the business capital obtained from the cattle business.

Henry admits that he is very glad for the services rendered by UGAFODE Microfinance Limited (MDI) in the form of loans because they have helped him so much to expand and diversify his business.

loans.use: To buy cattle for rearing

loans.name: Betty Carmen

texts.es:
La Señora Betty vive en Libertad, ella tiene 35 años de edad.
Ella comenzó vendiendo con su tía poca mercadería, en su vecindario, a sus amistades, a su familia pero poco a poco se fue independizándose hasta que  ella empezó a vender ya sola.
Ella vende la ropa todos los días de 9:30 de la mañana hasta las 11:00 del día y ahí se da un tiempo para volver a salir a las 16:000 hasta las 18:30 de la tarde. 
No tiene ninguna dificultad en su labor.
Ella  si tiene esposo y trabaja de albañil, y tienen 3 hijos de 13, 10 y 14 años edad.

Con el préstamo ella va a comprar mercadería para su negocio como: camisetas, pantalones, blusas. etc.
Ella desea mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Betty is 35 years old and lives in Libertad.

She began selling a little merchandise with her aunt— in her neighborhood to her friends and family, but little by little became independent, until she began to sell on her own. She sells clothing every day from 9:30am until 11:00am, so there is time for her to go out again at 4:00pm until 6:30pm. 

She has no problems in her work. She has a husband who works in construction, and they have three children, ages 14, 13, and 10.

With the loan she is going to buy merchandise for her business, such as T-shirts, pants, blouses, etc. She wishes to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: To buy merchandise for her business: T-shirts, shirts and pants.

loans.name: Tupendane C Group

texts.en:
Twaha, who is in his early 40s, is married with three children. Two of them are grown up and the last one is still going to school. Twaha has been a tailor for fifteen years now. He works from 8.00 am to 10.pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Twaha's 21st loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to buy more sewing machines. Twaha started with one sewing machine but now he has four sewing machines, plus employees. He used to sew Mosquito nets but now he makes good dress suits for men and can print labels on T-shirts. He used his profit to buy a plot of land and has started building his house. He also used the profit to pay school fees and cover household expenses. Twaha has paid back all his loans successfully. He will use this loan to buy a zig-zag machine for making designs on clothes. He dreams of finishing building his house, renovating his working place by enlarging it, and painting the shop to make it more attractive.

Twaha will share this loan with his loan group "Tupendane C" which has a total of 11 members, who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy a zig-zag machine for making designs on clothes.

loans.name: Jamila

texts.ru: Джамила трудолюбивая и добрая женщина. Ей 29 лет. Она разведена и воспитывает своего ребенка одна. Она живет вместе с родителями и сестрой. Джамила планирует организовать свой бизнес и таким образом стать независимой и обеспечить своего ребенка со всеми не обходимыми средствами. С такой целью она обучилась в курсе «Добейся успеха» организованный Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и получила сертификат. Теперь она вполне может организовать свой бизнес и стать успешной в этой сфере. Она хочет организовать бизнес выращиванием сельхоз культур, как помидор, картошка, корм и гранаты, так как имеет опыт в этом виде бизнеса. От полученного дохода она планирует улучшить условию проживания. Она запрашивает займ для покупки семена и минерального удобрения, чтобы организовать новый бизнес. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Jamila is a hardworking and kind woman.  She is 29 years old.  She is divorced and is raising her child alone.  She lives with her parents and sisters.  Jamila plans to start her own business and become independent and provide her child with all necessary resources.  With this goal she took the course "Get Ahead" organized by the National Association of Business Women of Tajikistan and earned a certificate.  Now she will be able to start her business and become successful.  She would like to start a farming business and grow produce such as tomatoes, potatoes, feed and pomegranates, as she has experience in this type of business.  She plans to use the profits to improve her living conditions.  She is asking for a loan to purchase seeds and mineral fertilizers in order to start her new business.  She is waiting for your kindness.

loans.use: to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers to start a new business

loans.name: Jeanine Del Rosario

texts.es:
Doña Jeanine de 59 años de edad, originaria de Matagalpa, actualmente vive en Managua, soltera, madre de 1 hijo, de oficio comerciante, se dedica a la elaboración y venta de nacatamales del que es propietario hace más de 20 años, ella realizo sus estudios hasta tercer año de secundaria. Inicio su actividad  ayudándole a su mama, fue allí que adquirió experiencia y total dominio del negocio, luego con el tiempo al independizarse decide seguir con el mismo negocio, porque le genera muchas ganancias a diario, este ha sido su primer negocio, el cual saca adelante con el apoyo de sus hijo y su mama, sus productos los comercializa en los barrios cercanos en donde vive.
Ella está necesitando el financiamiento para comprar leña, carne , tomates, papas, hojas de plátanos y un barril para almacenar los nacatamales. Toda la materia prima que necesita para la elaboración y darle el sabor a sus nacatamales, ya que el préstamo le será de mucha ayuda pues podrá invertir más en su inventario, incrementando su producción, de esta manera obtener mejores ingresos para la familia, una de sus metas es diversificar su negocio en otros lugares, pues su deseo es llegar a ser una de las mejores comerciante de la zona.
texts.en:
Jeanine, 59, is from Matagalpa, and currently lives in Managua. She is the single mother of one son and she works as a merchant who makes and sells nacatamales [banana leaf wrapped meat and rice dish].
